reviewText: I resisted watching this show because I was a huge ALIAS fan, which is about the dumbest reason on the planet. I finally broke down when a friend of mine was telling me about how wonderful it was, and I bought the first season on Amazon. I then went on a marathon, watching it all twice, and then gathering up all the episodes of season two. The parallels with ALIAS end at it being about a female agent in the CIA. Covert Affairs doesn't suffer from the heady mythology that ALIAS did. Anyone can pop into this show at any point and enjoy the heck out of it. Annie Walker, Joan and Arthur Campbell are terrific characters. I never expected to like Jai Wilcox, but I do. My favorite character is Auggie Anderson who touched a spot in my heart. This show is brilliant, and if you like spies you should watch it.

The USA Network television series "Covert Affairs" is a thoroughly entertaining and enjoyable combination of an exciting espionage thriller, and an engaging interpersonal drama. This second season continues to follow the exploits of Annie Walker, an intrepid young CIA operative, who demonstrates intelligence and wisdom beyond her years, in her pursuit of the successful completion of her designated missions. "Covert Affairs" features superb writing, acting, and plot development, and the performances of the lead actors, Piper Perabo and Christopher Gorham, are truly exceptional. "Covert Affairs" is an outstanding television series, and I give its second season a five-star rating, along with my highest recommendation.

More mumbling and dropped syllables. Not the worst example, S3E5 35:33, Annie says, "Penzuswatchi." Yep, that's how it came out 4x via Sony headphones. Clear as not what I finally figured out she was supposed to say. "Depends who's watching." A stage actor wouldn't mumble. TV actors, gawrd.

The director has heard the script, so he hears what he wants to hear. Brains fill in gaps, especially when they know what goes in the gaps. It even became almost clear to me when I knew what was being said. Someone in TV & movies should be in charge of demumblification.

Tons of product placement. The number of Bud Light bottles carefully turned toward the camera, or Breyers Ice Cream cartons, or the Apple logo on the iphones, blech. Not covert at all. Show should be re-titled, "Non-Covert Affairs with Commercial Interests for Product Placements."

It got better. The characters are more sharply drawn, and the writers got very good at finding "CIA" set pieces that work well in the allotted 40 minutes. The writers haven't succumbed to the easy plot devices that drag down shows like this, ie. people working against their own self-interest because a family member has been taken hostage, or a man character with a secret vice or any of the usual boring fare. The writers manage to keep it fresh.  Also, whereas Season 1 titles were all titles of Led Zeppelin songs, Season 2 makes liberal use of REM song titles.  What will season three be?  :)

If you like fast action, a good plot and average acting in the line of Bourne Identity et al then this is the TV series for you. Of course the heroine, Annie Walker played by Piper Perabo,  has to survive and win in order to appear in the next episode. Some good acting by the supporting cast such as Christopher Gorham who plays Auggie, the blind computer whizz kid and Ann Dudek, Annie Walker's sister. Good entertainment without taxing one's intellect too much. Not everyone's cup of tea, but it is mine.

It's pretty good.  You need to stick with it for a few episodes because the first couple aren't all that engaging.  Annie is an unlikely heroine whose novice errors work out okay just a little too often.  She's cute though, good hearted, and a great driver, and eventually you find yourself pulling for her and wanting to see the next episode.  But nowhere nearly as addictive as 24, Downton, Hell on Wheels, Justified, Walking Dead, etc

The relationship between Ben Mercer and Annie Walker was the best thing about this show. Their love was touching and almost epic. Then the show ruined it. The cruel way Annie dismissed Ben in episode "Welcome to the occupation" was a slap in the face of not only Ben but to all the fans of the show. It was a complete disregard of what they'd been through. And the show lost its most complex and charismatic character. What a waste.

This show really starts to pick up this season.  Most notably is one episode contains, perhaps, one of the best directorial shots in TV history.  Using "Gimme Shelter" as the soundtrack, the dolly shot starts with a couple standing up and making their way through a hotel banquet hall, through the lobby where they pick up someone tailing them, through the kitchen and out into the stairwell - all in one shot!

Covert Affairs is an entertaining and occasionally even nuanced look at spy craft and spies in the post-911 world.  Some of the scenarios seem a bit contrived, and the politics of relations between CIA and Congress are over-simplified.  But the heroine and her immediate colleagues ring true in an off-beat quirky sense, even if the motivations of her higher management remain murky and unrealistically complex.  You can briefly suspend your disbelief and enjoy the show.

I really enjoy this show. I never heard about it before looking at what Prime has to offer for streaming. Sometimes I watch 2 or 3 episodes because I so caught up with the action. There is an undercurrent running through for Annie Walker (CIA covert agent) and Augie who is blind due to his service in Afghanistan and  her closest friend at the bureau. He is no longer a field agent, but he always has her back when she is in danger. He has amazing digital spy equipment that monitors throughout the world and especially if Annie is involved. I know the CIA gets a bad rap sometimes, but they do some amazing stunts to get their agents out of harm's way.

We're enjoying this show--we're now on season 4--but it's becoming a bit predictable and is acquiring a soap-opera quality, though the characters are well-drawn and the acting is strong. The main character, Annie, is brave and resourceful but doesn't think things through, which is a bit frustrating.  My favorite character is Auggie, who is blind, clever, and funny, and who relieves the drama at times.  Their now (season 4) arch-enemy and nemesis, Henry Wilcox, is not only extremely irritating, as he should be, but rather unbelievable in his ability to thwart them.  We'll watch through season 5, after which it was cancelled, but probably won't re-watch it at a later date, despite the good suspense and mostly strong plot.

Great! Covert Affairs is great, packed with action, drama, suspense and mystery that keeps me intrigued, impressed and entertained with every show. The inside story of the CIA and operations performed with an outstanding cast, especially Piper and the rest of the team is my favorite and one of the best, if not the best, tv series.  Annie is my favorite character with some many impressive qualities, like fortitude, loyalty, tenacity, resourceful, smart, strong and more.  Piper's personality is so lovable and plays this character so well with tremendous talent, grace, poise and some of the same characteristics as Annie that make the Annie character real, personable, a great friend, teammate, ally and more.  Annie's tremendous intuition, ability to improvise and courage to overcome imminent threats, obstacles, challenges and villians effectively with intelligence is sometimes remarkably amazing leaving my intrigue always wanting more and looking forward to the next episode.

:)  I enjoy the music, too, from Apple Trees and Tangerines:  " 'Can you save me' from this nothing I've become?  It's just something that I've done.  I never meant to cause you worry.  Don't you blame me for this nothing I've become.  It's just something that I've done.  I never meant to show you my mistakes."

In 2011, Piper, the Golden-Girl, was, by far, the best Golden-Globe Nominee for "Best Performance by an Actress In A Television Series - Drama".  I look forward to her award-winning performance in Covert Affairs for many years to come.

The main character strains credibility as a spy who wins almost all fights with big bad-guys.  It is thoughtfully played out with her mostly unarmed and relying on her brains and language abilities to cope in the dangerous situations the plots take her.  I find the series a reliable watch when I need to catch something that is a pleasure to watch but does not require concentration to stay with the story.  A three star is an OK watch for me and a five star is almost never given.  This is four star because I appreciate a series that leaves me feeling my time was a pleasurably spent and glad I experienced it.

This is not just a review of Season 2.  The series started out slowly but got more and more interesting as the episodes progressed.  In the beginning, maintaining the double-life as an agent ... keeping family ties ... was part of the ongoing plot.  As the series progressed, the family-tie aspect got phased out and more intrigue and action took its place.  A strong female lead and a disabled veteran are major characters (you don't see that every day) and it works.  Seasons 3 and 4 were the most riveting for me.  If you like spy stories, I highly recommend Covert Affairs.

Season 2 is much like season one, except that Annie Walker is not obsessed with her lost love but is moving on in her CIA career.

There are a number of interesting story lines which slowly develop though this season, but the individual episodes generally resort to the same general story with varying backdrops and characters.  Some kind of spy activity is attempted by Annie, something goes wrong or some surprising fact is discovered that leads to the dramatic shoot out/car chase/rescue where Annie (Or one of her associates) saves the day, then queue the closing credits.  They are usually fun, but not deep, and after a few episodes you will be able to write the dialog yourself.

Watch them one or two at a time, just don't try and watch the whole season in one setting.

4 Discs containing 16 episodes and Special Features.  The production value stays strong with sharp clear images and no skips or jumps.

Disk 1:
1. Begin the Begin
2. Good Advices
3. Bang and Blame
4. All the Right Friends
-Bonus: Deleted Scenes for Good Advices

Disk 2:
5. Around the Sun
6. The Outsiders
7. Half a World Away
8. Welcome to the Occupation
-Bonus: Deleted Scenes for Around the Sun and Half a World Away

Disk 3:
9. Sad Professor
10. World Leader Pretend
11. The Wake-Up Bomb
12. Uberlin
-Bonus: Deleted Scenes for Sad Professor, World Leader Pretend, and Uberlin

Disk 4:
13. A Girl Like You
14. Horse to Water
15. What's the Frequency, Kenneth?
16. Letter Never Sent
-Bonus: Deleted Scenes for What's the Frequency, Kenneth? and Letter Never Sent
*Gag Reel
*Piper Perabo Comic-Con Intro
*Covert Affairs on Location: Istanbul, Venice, Berlin, and Stockholm

Somehow I missed this romantic spy thriller series when it began way back in 2010.  Now I got to see it all at once!  This is a high-production value series with a believable, gifted female star (Piper Perabo), top shelf co-stars (Christopher Gorham, Kari Matchett, Peter Gallagher) and supporting actors, fast-paced action all over the globe--much of it on-locale--and high test writers.  You can't go wrong getting caught up with Annie Walker, new CIA-operative, and her unfolding introduction to, and maturation with, the challenges faced by the United States in the modern world.  On second and third viewing, the detail worked into all five seasons of episodes becomes even more satisfying.  My only regret is that the series was ended in early 2015.  Be aware that, although the episodes are mostly self-contained, there is enough continuity in story lines which often bridge more than two episodes to warrant seeing these shows in series.  They are very effectively sequenced and paced--kudos to the directors.  Any possibilities for a movie spinoff?

We enjoy the fact that the "culprits" are different per-season. We do find some of the story lines a bit far fetched: Such as Wilcox being able to place anyone into the CIA- Lets face it if the SPY network can't uncover their own in-house spys/aka moles then why do we have the CIA again? . It would be cool to have the FBI and CIA team up in covert "exercises" aka contests in order to see who wins the SPY SUPERBOWL. Having none of the 'exercises' supposedly be real, but highly believable, perhaps allowing the audience to wonder if that was real or just a contest.  You know have a healthy-bragging rights at least. Would love to see Joan and Arthur be more of the 'creative married couple'. Fun-loving spy couple who everyone once and a while "DO" a covert operation together just so they don't get rusty and freshen up their roots.  Nice to find Auggie and Annie, (The A-team) getting together. Would enjoy seeing them secretly get-hitched. Again leaving the audience wondering if it really happened- you know, was the paperwork actually filed!  Might even be cool for him to have a short-term time of being able to see. Turning a blind-eye into a visual moment for both of them, before it fades away.... and den...= )  So far, so good.

Covert Affairs' story is easy to follow. Each episode has a twist along with a new plot, but still has scenes that tie in the whole season together. The characters are not too far into fiction that the "realism" effect is still there. Rarely any bad language so I can watch it in my living room. There are some very "hot" scenes but nothing too long or it doesn't last that long, which is a good thing. I didn't want to watch porno. Overall, great season, great plot and I can't wait to see season 3.

Seems like I read some gripes by folks that Season Two wasn't as good as Season One. Naw, don't believe it. The show is growing quite well, they've got Annie on a very well considered giant story arc as she matures into her position as a spy. And the storytelling is getting better all the time. My one complaint for Season One was that nothing about the show was "magical," but I've come to think that measure was a poor one for me to use. No one episode perhaps stands out (unlike, say, other favorites like Burn Notice and Leverage), but this series really seems to be taking the long view, and should be judged accordingly.  Plus, the two leads -- Piper Perabo and Chris Gorham -- continue to impress with their fine talents.

The second season was even better than the first. They cleaned up some of the cheesiness and it really was a fun and exciting watch. It still has an "Alias" feel but at the same time Covert Affairs has its own unique style and flair. I really like the second season and I am excited about Season 3

In season 2 we see a further development of Piper's CIA persona as each assignment presents new difficulties she must solve. And, she does, in remarkable ways, but with each assignment we see her dip into the dark side of ops and how it changes her. Piper Perabo does an excellent job in showing the conflicts "Annie" faces as she treads the path the CIA sets her on. The supporting characters continue to be an excellent foil for "Annie's" rapid development as a top operative - the stories are well written, well acted, and seem real. Piper's ability to run in those ankle busting high heels continues to amaze me!

If it weren't for the USA Network, I wouldnt have nearly as much TV to watch.  (I don't know if thats a good thing or a bad thing.)  While I love most of their shows, not every one is a winner.  Once such show is Covert Affairs.  The just finished season two was certainly entertaining, although it wasn't grab you exciting.

The show revolves around Annie Walker (Piper Perabo), a new agent at the CIA.  Shes beginning to get the hang of life as a spy, trying to balance that with her sister Danielle (Anne Dudek) who doesnt know what she does.  But the show really focuses on work, where Annie reports to Joan (Kari Matchett) whose husband Arthur (Peter Gallagher) is a director in the CIA.  Her co-worker Jai (Sendhil Ramamurthy) is very focused on climbing the ranks, while Auggie (Christopher Gormen) is content to stay in support but only because his blindness keeps them from going back out in the field.

The budget must have really been increased for this season because the show finds Annie traveling to more exotic locations, and some of these episodes were filmed on location.  She is sent to Paris to cultivate a new asset and flies to Berlin to help Peter with a former asset who happens to be his former girlfriend.  Closer  to home, Annie goes back to training to find out who is leaking new recruits names and starts surveillance on two brothers who might be part of a terrorist plot against the Spanish government.

Over the course of the season, Auggie gets a promotion and meets again the man responsible for his blindness, Jai learns the identity of the CIAs leak to the media and gets a promotion, and Danielle gets closer to learning what Annie really does.

Like manyUSANetwork shows, each episodes features a plot of the week as well as a few ongoing storylines.  On most of the shows, I get hooked on those stories and find the episodes of the week engrossing.  Here, I find the episode of the week diverting and the ongoing stories interesting but not must watch compelling.

So by now you're probably wondering why I keep watching the show.  Heres the reason.  I enjoy the show when its on.  It's just that I don't find myself thinking about it between episodes.  Its pleasant and fun but not absolutely must watch.

I think part of that is the fact that many of the characters are weak.  Joan and Peter especially have never been very well developed.  Dont get me started on Danielle, who is stuck with the thankless sub-plots that are just intended to flesh out Annies character.  Jai fairs a little better, but even he is pretty flat.  The weaker characters make it harder to care about on going stories.

Thankfully, Annie and Auggie are very well developed and interesting characters.  Maybe thats why Im fully invested in seeing these two come together eventually.  They have a great relationship and what appears to be a genuine friendship.

Now Im not going to fault any of the actors for the lack of character development.  When they are given something meaty to do, they tackle it with gusto and really make us believe the moments.  I find the entire cast believable every week, which is another reason I keep watching.

The show is a bit more story driven than character driven.  I always find the story of the week interesting.  Annie may not always make the best choices, but she is resourceful enough to get out of any danger she gets herself into.  They may not be edge of your seat, but they are compelling enough to keep me coming back.  Between the story of the week and Annie and Auggie, I definitely do enjoy the show while it's airing.

Season two consisted of sixteen episodes, and they are collected here on four DVD's in widescreen and full surround.  The set includes deleted and alternative scenes plus a gag reel.  There's also a featurette on filming the episodes that were filmed on location.

While not my favorite show on the USA Network, Covert Affairs is still fun and worth watching.  Season two held my interest.

I was disappointed with this show.  I was expecting a strong heroin and instead was forced to watch the most incompetent spy to ever lead a series.  As a fan of this genre, I expected a strong lead female character in the vein of  La Femme Nikita, Nikita, Alias, even Dollhouse, but found myself watching a character who goes out of her way to suck at her job, get caught, and be rescued EVERY SINGLE EPISODE!  She consistently breaks her cover or is discovered while keeping secrets from her friends and family (the people who she should trust and confide in) while divulging national secrets to complete strangers in an effort to "win their trust", or some BS like that.  The show is thoroughly unbelievable even as fantasy, and the main character, Annie Walker, is a complete disaster.
  Don't get me wrong though, the actors were great and do a phenomenal job portraying their characters, but the writers should have been replaced after season 1.  They decided to create a character who was a SPY who can't lie, falls in love with EVERY asset she encounters, has the hand-to-hand skills of a 4 year old (she literally gets beat up every episode), and the trade-craft of Johnny English.  I dredged through the series in hopes to find that her character grew, but instead she just got worse every episode, to the point that I could anticipate the plot after the first 10 minutes of the episode. Here it goes...
SPOILER: An event happens, she gets briefed, the seasoned professionals come up with a plan, but she comes up with an unorthodox way to accomplish it, they "give her a chance".  She meets an asset.  She finds the "good" in the asset, causing her to compromise the mission and fail.  The Seasoned Professionals come up with a contingency plan, or decide to scrub the mission.  She disagrees, goes off book and tries to finish the mission anyway.  This fails, she has to be broken out of jail or rescued by a blind guy or a deus-ex-machina old acquaintance.  The asset is saved and she goes back to work, praised for her cunning, "instinct", and stick-to-it attitude.  Wash, rinse, repeat...  Take my word for it, EVERY EPISODE is exactly like this.  I dare anyone to find a single episode that isn't.
  Ultimately, I felt like I lost several hours of my life and should have spent the time finally watching Breaking Bad or at least re-watching Nikita or Fringe.  If you can manage through the first season, then this is for you, but if you are annoyed by the end, trust me, it just get exponentially worse as it continues.  So sad.

After all, most cops never fire their weapons any place other than a shooting range.

I've been watching this on my Prime account. Season 1 was a little choppy. The writers hadn't seemed to quite decide what they wanted to do with the show. It was OK, but the characters hadn't found their voice, yet. Season 2 has the consistency of a great show. The characters had matured into complete individuals. I'm a spy story junkie. There's enough of that to keep me happy. At the same time, there's a lot about how the characters interact. And that doesn't detract at all from the spying aspect of the show. It's not all guns and explosions, but there's enough excitement to keep most of us happy.

Tawdry at best with a sad attempt to humanize spies while making the protagonist who uses her blonde hair and dumb luck to get complete her missions.
Here is everything wrong with the show
1. Her language skills are some how achieved through both exotic travels as well as a high brow education which leaves me wondering where does a military brat get the money to get an Ivy league masters level education and to travel the world aimlessly. Not saying that military families don't get an education or some type of government aid for that education but her whole life story seems far-fetched. What has she done for money the rest of her adult life?
2. The only reason Annie is living with her sister is to add the sense of danger that some bad guys will find out she is CIA and kidnap her family. If she really is some impressive Smithsonian employee like her cover story claims, why is she still living with her family?
3. Since when does a three week beach romp count as a serious relationship? Ben's disappearance in the middle of life saved both Ben and Annie's life, you think she would get over it and cut him some slack.
4. Not that I don't think blind people are capable but Aussi seems like a guy who trying to act like he is blind not like someone who is actually blind. If that is some plot twist in the future, I'm not sticking around to see it.

This show is kind of an anti-24, showing a kinder, gentler U.S. spy operation via sweet Annie Walker vs. super-bad Jack Bauer. Annie would never attach electrodes to anyone to stop a bomb plot, yet somehow she still saves the day. Her superiors are actually the good guys and not Jack Bauer's bureaucratic incompetents and red-tape artists. There are a few aspiring self-seeking bureaucratic careerists in Annie's world, but they exist in a a thus far only in an underdeveloped subplot and are not in center stage as they were in Jack Bauer's 24.

This show has a great first three seasons. The actress who plays Annie, Piper Perabo, has that Julia Roberts smile and a bit of Roberts' mystique. The show includes good plots, good acting, beautiful photography and locations.
As other have mentioned, yes, the plots are a bit predictable -- superior tells Annie not to do something, and she does it anyway, and it all winds up well.
There are a number of inconsistencies with reality.
Would the CIA really pull a trainee from The Farm because they did not have anyone else who was an attractive female agent who could speak Russian? I can see it if they needed an agent who could speak Xhosa.
Why would Annie, who drives a cheaper car and lodges with her sister and brother-in-law, have a huge collection of $700 Louboutin red-sole shoes -- not to mention that very high-heeled shoes are hardly professional or practical for the foot chases she is guaranteed to get in every episode? Especially later, locations are shot up and there are spectacular car chases and crashes, but the police rarely get involved. Every male agent Annie deals with could be a male model, and she falls almost-into and out-of romances quickly. In the first season, the CIA seems to require women to wear low-neckline dresses, but these get more realistic later. The sex scenes are all identical -- soft light, music, Annie's bare shoulder and perhaps her bra. Very predictable. Would a high-ranking CIA officer such as Joan go around as a blonde with black roots? In one hospital resuscitation scene, the patient has flat-lined but still has a 110/70 blood pressure, plus of course the patient is shocked back into consciousness -- flat-lined patients are not shocked!
It's also quite senseless that Annie would never use any type of disguise, and that she would tell almost everyone her real name.
The first few seasons there are a set of books behind Arthur's desk -- as the head of a department within the CIA, why would Arthur need a dozen volumes of annotated California statutes (the dark blue books) in his office? The khaki colored books are legal case books -- appropriate for a law office library, not to a CIA director.
And a blind man having the job as the lead tech -- which includes analyzing photos in some episodes? Impossible that the CIA would use someone whose lack of sight would slow him down or make him delegate some tasks to others. Auggie could be a trainer, a mentor, an advisor, but not head tech/ sometime field operative.
And really -- a foreign source is told to meet his CIA contact (Annie), but he is only told to meet "an American blonde who will accept your invitation to coffee," with no sign/countersign -- not to mention that he carries that description with him on a typed sheet on the way to the meeting? No way that could go wrong. (Yes, of course it goes wrong and the wrong contact meets the wrong blonde.)
As then, as the series goes on, heading into Seasons 4 and 5, the show "jumps the shark" with byzantine plot devices. Henry turns into a sinister all-knowing string-pulling Professor Moriarty / Mycroft character. Former spouses and children of characters, and faked deaths, never mentioned before, start popping up. Agents go "rogue" or "dark" left and right, working their own, or someone else's, secret agendas. The first three seasons are good, but pull the plug on the rest.

Given that Justified, Orange is the New Black, the Americans, and Breaking Bad are 5-star quality in my view, 4 stars is a good rating. The characters are solid for TV but not really 5-star memorable and the writing is above par for TV. The production values are excellent and the acting is good for a TV series. The stories are well developed up to the climax of each show, then they seem to wrap up too quickly. The back stories of the characters are well done and help sustain the show when the main plot is a little weaker than usual. I love the location shooting and the productions are excellent for tread mill watching. The Americans is a much better "spy story", but is also a darker work. But there is time to watch both.

I've recently finished watching all four seasons of Covert Affairs. I doubt I will watch any episodes/seasons after Season 4. If it wasn't for the ensemble cast (although Piper Perabo seems to be the main 'attraction') I couldn't watch due to Perabo's lack of acting skills. The following may contain SPOILERS: It was nice when Auggie and Annie finally got together but it was ruined when Auggie slept with Helen--where was this love this he supposedly had for Annie? By the end of Season 4 Annie looked and acted hard. While this is a show, it would be nice if they made it more real. Annie never tries to disguise herself (she never even changes her name!) until she goes 'dark' at the end of Season 4. The show could use a lot of work, but they really missed the mark with the Auggie and Annie relationship!

Season 1 left me entertained but with some areas definitely lacking.  Season 2 steps up overall as the character Annie does as well.  Season 1 treated many topics with a little to much "fluff" and leaving the impression that the main character while successful in her job was more lucky than good.  Season 2 gives us a more mature agent to watch which I guess plays in step with the storyline as she is no longer fresh out of "the farm" and now has some experience to draw on and demonstrated enough that her superiors and peers have more confidence in her.  Some of the blatant issues with the storyline were addressed head on making Annie's personal life more believable and then some were swept away (like her sister suddenly becoming a single mom without addressing where her brother in law went).  Overall the season took the show a step in the right direction and I can see consistency in how the characters are working out life vs. the secrecy around their job just as Annie works out or on some of the bigger life issues that in the first season left her looking more like a kid in a grown up world.  But in retrospect Season 1 was about her being pulled from the farm early and being thrown into live CIA work and being successful in spite of not "graduating" and her intuition being good relative to her work.  I simply had to see Season 2 and see the story develop to know that the character was going to mature and the show not continue to focus on her being a newbie.  I'm sticking with 4 out of 5 as the show has improved it simply  hasn't taken me to the place of considering it excellent as apposed to good.  I still summarize it as entertaining and worth watching, but 5 stars are for those shows that years after they are gone I still wish I could watch.  Given this isn't one of my favorite genre's actually says a lot about the show in and of itself as there aren't a lot that I even watch so I may be judging it more harshly because I don't look for as many shows in this category to fill my time, I tend more towards books in this genre, which may be why I'm looking for more detail than is provided.  But I have at least 3 more seasons to make that final determination, for now seasons 1 and 2 are good entertainment I give a 4 out of 5 and am enjoying.

Coming from a fan of 24 and ALIAS (only one of which has recently made a come back) I enjoy this show. Obviously, the genre is my favorite. There are some pretty awful blue screen shots that I find noticeable, but most people either won't notice or simply breeze by it. I love the content of the show, the witty banter and camaraderie between Annie Walker and Auggie Anderson, and even appreciate the relationship between Annie's superiors, Joan and Arthur. I hate the "intro" to the show, something like this is appropriate for a show like Chuck, but not a spy series like Covert Affairs. I feel like it's cheesy and sets the wrong mood for the content of what you're about to watch. That being said, it's kept me interested enough to keep watching and look forward to the next episode! I give it a four star rating, doesn't touch ALIAS or 24, but it's addictive and interesting enough to earn a good rating, and I appreciate how much the actors and writers put into the effort. Now if someone could get them better music, a new intro, and more professional special effects, this show would be perfect!

I look forward to watching this series for a nice break in the middle of a busy day.  I have always loved the "spy" genre, including James Bond, Mission Impossible, I Spy, etc. A  Covert Affairs episode is like a little slice of that genre, a mini spy thriller.  I am only now in the 2nd season, so I keep wondering when and if Annie will ever get a gun, but I love the way she uses her wits to survive seemingly impossible odds.

Another thing that I love about the series is that the protagonist is a strong female character, while remaining feminine.  I have always enjoyed series with strong female characters (Dark Angel, Wonder Woman, La Femme Nikita, etc.), perhaps because I have often wished that my abused mother had been stronger.

So this series has the drama, the mystery, the strong female character, the exotic locations, the sexiness of a bond thriller, and even a few gadgets.  I recommend it to anyone who enjoys those elements.  I am happy to have discovered this series.
I was surprise that this show is entertainingly mysterious  and funny. I also enjoy seeing new talent appear on the television scene.

I love this show! This is the season in which Annie reveals to her sister that she works for the CIA. In my opinion, seasons 1 & 2 were the best. Annie still had a more vulnerable side. Of course, characters must evolve & change. The show is always action packed! I love the friendship between Annie & Auggie! If you like shows with a strong but vulnerable female lead, then this is a great one!
A little cheeky, but I like it. And Piper is easy on the eyes. Good show. I will keep watching it.

A fun watch.  Not exactly a Jason Bourne thriller, not completely believable plot elements, but one of the most entertaining spy series.  Humour, suspense, enough action, and some character development.

I am only into the 2d season, and I am hoping that Annie will lose her deer-in-the-headlights look as she becomes more experienced and more self-confident.
Piper is excellent in her roll as Annie Walker.  The stories are interesting and the locations are often very beautiful.  Really, really love this series. . .I wish they would keep filming it.
Kept the interest over the entire season. Thanks for Amazon Prime. Varied enough to continue watching through. Enjoy the experience.

This is another film with a female hero.  She is vunerable and tough and very focused. This film has more than enough beautiful men. A real twist is a blind veteran who is very intelligent and gets around almost too well to be believed.  It is full of twists and usually ends each segment with you dying to see what happens next.
This is a great series, love catching up on previous seasons. Hope it returns soon. Great great great show, must see
this is a great series. cant wait til the next season comes out. lots of action and secrets. great watch

I saw two episodes of Covert Affairs on a flight back from L.A. so when I saw it on my Amazon Prime, I started watching season 1.  That was two weeks ago and I've been "binge-ing" on this ever since!  Each show is more or less the same. Spy goes on mission; suspense builds; action scene, resolution.  Nonetheless, I find it entertaining and I'm more interested in the ongoing story lines that are woven throughout the entire show.

This is one of my favorite shows & I am thrilled to own it now!!  The characters lead a very stressful life dealing with their jobs, family, and the overlapping they sometimes have to deal with.  Very real personalities & subject matter, even for those of us not in the CIA!  :)

I highly recommend this show!
Great acting, drama, adventure, travel - could do with LESS VIOLENCE!!! The connection between the two leads appears real. Show less blood!
One of my favorite shows. I love seeing all the different countries they travel to. Can't wait for the new season!
Truly enjoying the show. It was nice to go back and watch at a slow pace and see any shows I've missed.
I am rarely engaged by any television series, but Covert Affairs has me hooked.  Annie Walker is a fascinating protagonist.
I think it has been amateurish. Too much social time takes up time that could be used for intrigue and action.
This series is an entertaining series that may not have a basis in reality. But then, who wants reality when you want to chill out.
Have been enjoying the plots and intrigue as the show has developed. Interesting main characters. New a dull moment. Highly recommend for a fun ride every episode.

Each episode has a main theme that begins and ends yet the lives of the characters carry on throughout the season without interfering with the current episode you are watching. There is good chemistry among the actors.

I wanted to start a new series and this was the one! The producers/writers take the time to introduce the characters so that the viewer has an opportunity to develop attachments so that you care or not if they live or die! Annie, the agent is the perfect mix of sexy, power and beyond smart!!! This is a true CIA show. The acting is five star quality.

My husband and I stumbled upon the Covert Affairs series and absolutely love every episode!  We really enjoy any type of spy movie or TV show --- whether it's FBI, CIA or double agent stuff.  And this series really fits the bill.  If you're into spy movies..... this is the perfect series for you.  Enjoy!
One of the most fun shows I've watched in a long time. Not any of the gore you get with some of the dramas out there. A little lighter!

THIS SHOW IS MY ONE AND ONLY TRUE FAVORITE. ANNE CAN KICK ASS AND TAKE NAMES, SHE IS MY KIND OF WOMAN. I JUST FELL HEAD TRESSESOVER HEALS IN LOVE WITH HER AND THE ACTING IS FLAWLESS BY ALL THE ACTORS AND ACTRESSES THIS IS A MUST SEE SHOW FOR THE ONE WHO LIKES ADVENTURE AND SUSPENSE.
This show has a very good story line.  There is a lot of action, suspense and even humor.  It is a show that can be followed one right after the other.
Poor acting combined with a formula story line. Always ends with a shootout or impossible to believe escape. Throw in a few tacky love scenes and you could write endless scripts with a computer.
Great series.  Full of suspense, action and drama.  Keeps me on my toes, with the unexpected twists and turns. Must watch.
The show is fantastic and brilliantly conceived and it doesn't hurt that Piper is a beautiful actress.  I love spy movies/shows all the different countries the show features in almost every show.

I had never heard of it before I saw it on Amazon.  I have been binge watching it and am totally hooked.  I love seeing all the great places she travels.  I am sure it must make real CIA agents cringe but it is very entertaining to watch.  She really gets herself in some messes.
This was a good season.  We liked it better before Henry became the focus of the series.  Augie and Annie are heating up.
It's a really awesome show I watched all four seasons and love it;it kinda if you like action , twists & surprises .can't wait for season 5!!!!
I am enjoying season 2 as much as season 1. The excitement continues with many surprises,twists and turns to the story. I will probably return to this series again in the future.
Season 2 continued the momentum of the first season. Looking forward to how Season 3 takes the show!  Piper has a charisma that projects on screen making her likeable and sexy at the same time!

I was hooked from the very first episode in season 1.
I felt that it is very well written. It never gets boring .
My daughter and friend are avid fans as well.
THIS IS A GREAT SERIES ACTION, STORY, REALISTIC, VERY WELL WORTH YOUR TIME, I HOPE THEY CONTINUE THIS SERIES LOVE IT
Although I like this program and will continue to watch the additional seasons I have not watched yet, it is becoming very predictable. It's nice light entertainment.
Great character development in this series. Was a little disappointed that the main star got a little promiscuous at the end.

This series is above average, but it's not "Sons" or "Breaking bad" . Piper is ok, but the real star is the blind kid.
I don't anticipate watching episodes of this series, but once I'm involved with one, it is satisfying. It's a touch on the
light side.
I like Covert Affairs, it is a well produced and well acted series.  It is a great way to kill some time and the fact that it is included with Prime is a real bonus.

This series is one of the best that I have seen in a long time. The cast was right on and made this a must see on a regular basis.  Piper Perabo has definitely gotten her craft down and has shown good depth and breadth as far as the writing allowed, and it had great promise.

Lose the adolescent view of the "hookup" mentality that poorly substitutes for real relationships and this excellent group of actors could have made a real gem out of this story line. Writers shouldn't stay in the shallow "pee pee caca" show yours and I'll show mine micro thin waste of time if they really are out for more than cheap money. anyone can make money...but this cast could have done real art.

What started out as a 5 star program with great character interactions, great film locations and great Western world view has degenerated into moral relativism.  You have been trapped into the Communist error that sex to accomplish an objective is ok.
No, that is not the value of a Christian/Jewish state.  Your show was great without the more and more explicit sex as well.

Enjoyed the stories, sub-plots, character portrayals, and action.  It's a spy drama with some intricately woven plots/sub-plots that has a little bit of everything: action, office-politics CIA style, lighter moments, great characters played by a wonderful cast....Don't over analyze, watch it and enjoy.
More exciting developments than season one. A lot of drama. But, outdoor shoots  needs to be more real and believable.
The program is well done. A simple enjoyable series of plots.  Good character development. I have gone back to watch the series and have made it to season 2. I have enjoyed it.
Loved Seasons  and 2. Now in the middle of Season 3. Love the characters, plots, everything! It is a great series and I highly recommend!
It is too bad that there are not more fun series like this one.  It is also to bad that the CIA obviously in the real world can not hire the best and brightest.
This is a fun unconventional spy show. Love Ogy's Character. All the characters are well developed and the emotions/relationships are well portraded.
It holds your interest as you try to identify who is actually who and why for yourself. Many surprises. Well written and acted.
I have enjoyed Season 2 of Covert Affairs, character are better developed in Season 2 with very good plots and story line.
awesome show. great characters and story lines. Lots of action. Husband even enjoys this one. Can't wait to see what happens next
I can't help it, I love spy shows. I really think the characters are great and it is easy to get involved in their lives.

Covert Affairs is the best spy show since La Femme Nikita (the original series with Peta Wilson, not the dimwitted redux version on CW), even better than Alias, which I loved.  Piper Perabo shows herself to be one of the best young actresses working today and is long overdue for an Emmy nomination for her work on this show.  My only complaint is that while it does show a few bad-guys at the CIA, overall the show paints far too nice a picture of that agency.
007 in a skirt without a gun and skirt sometimes. Its nice to have different plots each week taking place in different country's.

I only give it a 3 because it's fluff.  The main characters are good actors but some of the others not so much.  Having said that, I really enjoy watching it - it's light and entertaining and sometimes the plot is a surprising.  If you like Castle or if you liked Chuck, Covert Affairs is along the same line.  Annie has more hutzpah than she lets on, and Auggie is a great character.  Enjoy watching!
We really enjoyed watching the series. It is well done and spans the globe to give you a view of different countries. I am looking forward to season five.
Awesome show, but can't stop watching it.  Where are some of the actors now?  Keeps me on the edge of my seat.

Very well written and the actors especially Piper really know how to draw you in and make you care about them. The show is very addictive.  You just can't stop at 1 episode. ... before you know it, you are half way through a season.

I loved Season 1 and so I thought okay...I guess I'll watch Season 2.  Well Season 2 was even better.  It kept me glued to the screen (of my Kindle) and roped me in for seasons yet to come.  It's a great show.  The characters are more complex and the relationships intertwine,and grow, and of course, Piper Perabo is perfect for this role. And Hill Harper?  (swoon)  Let's see them become "friends". World travels, red bottom shoes, great clothes, beautiful people, big guns, action and intrigue galore. When do we get to see Season 5?  I'm watching all the seasons over again.  Thanks Amazon.
I enjoyed the first season but the show is getting sillier and sillier.  The plots are not well conceived and I hardly find any of the story lines convincing.
Excellent entertaining series! This show has action, drama and is entertaining for all. It has a different plot each episode, but with the same characters.
Season two was pretty good.  The story build-up plots for season 3.  I enjoyed watching thought out all the shows.

Still very good, very realistic, quite captivating narrative, the internal political skirmishes give it  a truthful quality. Too bad Walker's
first romantic attachment (Ben Mercer) had bowed out, at least that relationship happened "naturally" (or so I was led to belive),
unlike "seduction by order" of an intelligence boss.
Stay up with the characters and watch the changes in Annie. A lot more USA activity than I thought was legal.

Ms. Perabo is no doubt beautiful and lights up the screen, BUT, she's in the C.I.A.? Wearing 4 inch Louboutin heels? Running in every episode? Hand to hand combat? Not a mark on her face and she gets away every time....long shots of her walking away? The show strikes me as being  some adolescent male fantasy with some ab shots of Chris Gorham for the girls. Too cutsie for me.

My wife and I are enjoying the episodes of Covert Affairs.
Just started season 3 and we are still hooked.
This is my favorite show. I really enjoyed watching the shows that I had missed, and have a greater appreciation for the continuous story line.

if you enjoy watching Bondish movies then this is what to watch
latest fashions; world travel --just into season 2 and its still entertaining
Loved this show. Couldn't wait for next episode.  Glad season 2 and 3 are available. Looking forward to seeing them
This show is different than the average cop shows out there. Interesting plots. Like the spy helping spy episodes. Love Augie.

This program is very well done and feels like it is realistic when watching it. It keeps your interest and keeps you coming back for more. Piper Perabo is very pleasant and she does and excellent job portraying a CIA operative.

She seems to be the best thing since Jack "24". She gets the job done and does not allow even her handler or up management stop her from doing what she feels she needs to do to get the job done. Excellent program looking forward to seeing more of this type of action.
Don't know how I missed this on TV . Great series for a binge! The characters and plot keep me coming back!

As noted shallow plot, thankfully populated by many very beautiful and quite resourceful ladies. Ms Perabo is a highly talented, sensuous and versatile actress. The supporting cast does a credible and often enjoyable job. I would recommend it to anyone recognizing it is a light, easily digestible show
Plots, though entertaining, are repetitious.  The lead actress has the whole range of acting ability from A to B.  I watched it because it was free and because I am  housebound.
Watched all 4 seasons and each season kept getting better.  Would like to see it return, the wrting/acting was great.
Enjoy that their is one big story going on through out the season with a smaller story in each episode.
Not realistic, but fun to watch as a diversion. I've gotten to know the characters and like the interplay between all of them
We enjoy the characters in this show and think it is well cast.  It has the humorous banter between main characters that we like.
A cute show with just enough action and comedy. The characters are likable and draw you in making you root for the good guys.

CIA procedural featuring exotic locations, a strong and capable heroine, superb male eye candy, ripped-from-the-headlines-storylines, appealing and well-drawn characters of both sexes, and a lot of action sequences in wholly inappropriate but exquisite shoes.
Interesting show. I watched 3 seasons on amazon prime in a week so I guess it must be good lol
Great light entertainment. I love watching one show after another. Addicted to the series. I would recommend this show to others.
I love this show, but season 2 I was not as interested in as season one. Still good to watch though and see the characters evolve.
OMG, I loved Annie and Simon.  I was so sad when he died, but I love Annie & Auggie more.  If you are looking for great storylines, look no further.  I recommend this to anyone, excellent show.
This show is great.  We watch it pretty much every night now.  The chemistry between the actors is incredible.  Keep this show on, we will keep watching...  Good job to the writers.

I think this show gets better each year.  I respect the P Perabo for daring to look worn and beaten and un-made up - in other words she looks the part as required.  No huge ego here.  I don't like that she and Auggie became lovers - they were so good as friends.  And I miss Eyal
Keeps your attention.  Always exciting.  Enjoy seeing exciting places around the world especially same places I've visited myself.  Never boring.
Interesting plots, good character development, not too violent.  My only gripe is; they sometimes try to cram too much into one episode.
I truth like the Covert Affairs, better then 24, because she play a very good character on the television show.  The show get more action, drama, and mystery as well.

I have not always been a big fan of Piper. I enjoyed her in Coyote Ugly but hadn't followed her career before and after that movie. I started watching the show because of the storyline/plot line. Nearly any CIA-, FBI-, MI5-, or MI6-related show will catch my attention, in fact. But it was 100% Piper that maintained my interest. I loved the first season, hooked nearly immediately, and have been impressed with the writers' and actors' growth and development over the seasons. It truly just gets better and better. I cannot wait for seasons 4 & 5 to be available on Amazon Prime (I don't have cable - like most Americans today). Bring it on Amazon!! Get to it!!!

Annie's adventures as a CIA agent continue in season 2 of Covert Affairs. I enjoy watching her escapades and discovering how she manages to juggle the double life of living with her sister and being a covert operative.
This is anterrific series.  The characters are interesting as well as excellent plots. I enjoyed Season 1 very much and was happy that Season 2 has remained consistent.

This is an engaging series with top notch performances. As the series has progressed, the characters' moral fiber becomes more and more apparent, making them either villains or heroes, and at the same time, they are human, so that empathy is not lost. Whether this was by design or not, it is the very thing that some of us as Americans are struggling with, the apparent lack of accountability of the CIA to the observing American people and even more recently to Congress itself.  We need the CIA, but we also need integrity and accountability. It would be more acceptable if everyone in the CIA and their actions were as attractive as the characters in this series, and if all actions were as noble. But at any rate, the show gives us a perception of a kinder and gentler agency, which we can live with. I rated the series, which I hope does not in any way rate the actual CIA! I would highly recommend Covert Affairs!
My wife absolutely loves this show,thats why I gave it five stars. I hope they continue to put more shows like th i s on.

Covert Affairs appears to be a mixed attempt at a spy thriller and "Chuck"...it comes complete with a sister and interoffice politics. The story-line is uneven....It even tried to be a LITTLE racy. Anything to entice viewers....
Dynamic and good stor and  good  cast. Liked both seasons  one and two.  We are looking forward to watch  season  three
I absolutely love it! Wish amazon prime showed more seasons (free) after the season was over. Totally awesome series! More is needed.
I like it a lot, lots of action, good story line. Reminds me of a good spy movie. I will be watching more episodes.

I started with Season 1, got addicted and couldn't quit. Luckily you don't have to wait a week for the next episode. If you are a
spy fan, this is for you.

This show is full of surprises and it keeps my intrest peeked.
I look forward to each new episode.
I hope the series continues .
Great show!
This show is wonderful. some episodes are not realistic but over all I find it just as good as Justified can not get enough
Loved it!!!! Great plot, great characters, not too much drama (love that), and keeps me wanting more as a result!!
Lots of interesting characters to follow besides obviously the main one. Good plots for an hour long show. I will keep watching now!
I really am enjoying this series.  The characters are fun and the plots engaging.  I recommend this for general audiences.

I love this show, because it has everything a great spy drama needs. Amazing characters, crazy plot lines, and tons of adventure and romance. I also think that it is really true to the actually lives of CIA agents.
The show and characters continue to grow, so looking forward to season 3. Still a show that we and the three teens can enjoy together.

Thrilling!
Every episode is full of more drama and action than the previous season.
I'm sure I will run to the next season immediately.
A light hearted series that helps you relax.  Takes you to lots of interesting places with a few twist and turns.

Interesting television program. Great cast. Well acted. Entertaining. Keeps one thinking why are they dong this and what's next. Plot lines leave you hanging after each episode. One of the best written shows in this recent era of television programming. Hope it stays on this path moving forward. It's one on the only programs I watch with regularity.
Has glamorous people, exotic locations, some mystery, and interesting plots.  The action is good and there is a bit of romance or flirting during missions.
Some good roles, but too much of a pro cia PR show. Would be better if it explored moraly ambitious plots that are part of spy world.
This show is starting to hit its stride in suspense as all the characters get sorted out and start to expand.
I like the show because it is entertaining.  However,it's not a very realistic portrayal of a CIA operative. I will continue to watch the program because I like the characters.
I love this show.  It is fast moving, funny, sexy.  Every show is great.  Lots of good looking actors on this one.
Every 'under cover' op Annie works, her cover name is Annie Walker. Really? This is pathetic.  It's sad, because the show has potential.
Piper Perabo is great as Annie Walker.... I love a strong gal taking the lead and Joan is also great!

This show gets better with each episode and every season. The characters grow get more complex and more interesting. Love Piper although she does alot of running in high heels. Can't wait for season 4. I am not paying to watch more tv though. I pay for cable,  Netflix, Amazon prime so no I am not paying $40 to watch season 4. I will wait for USA & season 5  and hopefully they will repeat season 5.
It is great to be able to catch up with the show. We became fans in season 4. Amazon has allowed us to understand the history and past relationships
great series...i started watching in the 3rd season, so now going back to the beginning to see what i missed.

I think the actors are a perfect fit and very believable.
I like how no one is like unbeatable or super MacGyver like.
Annie's smile just has you rooting for her, and the flirting with Auggie really works.
Story is ok, acting isn't.  A CIA without a gun?  I'm not completely behind this one but my wife likes it.
this season is freaking awesome! I love the combination Piper Perabo + Christopher Gorham + Kari Matchett. Please keep them all!
Even worse that season 1, the language is horrible and it is very uncalled for.  Would be a great series if it wasn't for the language

I love CIA, FBI shows. The characters work well together and they are believable. They go through the same life problems that we do only accelerated. Well written and I look forward to each and every episode.

I found that it keeps you interested; always something to grab your attention...
The writers and players do their jobs well...
This just keeps getting better. I sit down to watch one show and next thing I know, its 3 hours later and I just watched a couple more.

Thoroughly enjoyable as the first season, with a twist
Annie growing to be a mature young lady and versatile asset
Great show! Very well written and acted! It is great to have this on Amazon Prime! There are so many great shows on Prime!
Action with great players and each session ends with a good feeling. The suspend and action is portrayed in good taste and like the female roles.
This is an enjoyable series.  They manage to come up with different themes and locations which adds to the interest level.

It's certainly an action packed series. It's fast moving, much like the "Event" was. Good acting, plots, and all needed for this subject. I find this doesn't do for me what the Event series does. Never the less, it is a good show.
Sometimes you need a little spy intrigue.  Love brains over Braun every time.  Boys play rough, girls play smart. Great cast?
My husband and I happened upon this by searching, and we have thoroughly enjoyed getting caught up in this series.  We're now watching season 2.
The writing gets progressively better in this series..Piper Perabo is totally underrated as an actress...wish she did more films..Covert Affairs is a hit and I hope they keep churning out seasons...

Tired of gratuitous sex and violence?  Want a reasonably decent plot with partially believable characters?  Want acting not out of a cheese whiz can?  This won't keep you up late, but it won't alter your personality, either.  I use it to time my workout, and it works for me.  Not bad at all, much better than Andy Griffith or The Rifleman.

Piper is always sexy and attractive. She seems fragile ... but got out of very tight situations. Ogie is the guardian angel. I stil have not finish Season 2, yet. Had seen some of them on TV until the last season. Still, I will go through each of them on Amazon Prime.
I love the Covert Affairs series. Season 2 was even better than season 1. I think the acting is fantastic. Love Piper Perabo. I enjoy the actors and their roles. Very entertaining.
I would recommend this series to anyone who likes "spy" type shows. Hope Season 4 will be on Prime soon.
Season 2 continues a very good show. The characters continue to be developed and the storylines are interesting.  Looking forward to season 3.

Lead character uses her wits as often as her fighting technique. terrific supporting cast. Music often reflects well with the story being told. Examines the complexity of espionage life in several countries.
Interesting program.  Not your typical shoot'em up: auto chase, spy bore.  Well acted. I have enjoyed the first two seasons looking forward to the third season.
It is an excellent series with great action. They are really starting to develop Annie into a really interesting character.
A lady James Bond?  Not exactly.  More like mixing a beautiful female spy with the approach of John Le Carre'.  I'm not on the third season and I'm still enthralled with characters.
It's nice to see a strong female role that is believable. Over all a it's a good show to watch.
Can't wait to get caught up with the series just love watching it. Recommend it for everyone that likes spy movies
I am still amazed by what the main character can get away with without being caught. You can only rely on luck so many times.
Every episode contained unexpected twists.  The actors perform very well and it is easy to follow the action.  I consider this one of the best series I have reviewed.
I enjoy watching. It keeps me thinking of what is going to happen next. Annie Walker is good at her job. I really like the action and how it all play's out.

Many shows produced recently take themselves so seriously and require strange convolutions of the mind to try and follow their stories. Covert Affairs is fun and not quite so twisting with its story lines. A fun drama to watch and enjoy.
I think covert Affairs is my new favorite if you like action drama type movies with great characters. Its my new favorite.
Good series, I have enjoyed all three seasons. Some big surprises in season three that I did not expect which even makes it more fun. What's next?

Covert Affairs just keeps getting better & better. Family is enjoying these series and keeps you engaged. Characters and plot is developing very nicely. We love the characters and the acting is exemplar.

This is truly a fun, action packed great storytelling to watch every night! - Worthy of 5 stars!
entertaining, I watched season 1 & then 2 & it seemed a little typical, but like I said good entertainment

I never did watch this program when it first came out as the ads were not appealing. Now I have the chance to start at the beginning and skip the commercials. I am into Season 3 currently and will finish the entire package soon.
I love covert affairs! I started watching it on tv at the end of season 2. To be able to watch the entire season was AWESOME !!
If you liked Alias you will like this show, Piper (Amie Walker) even reminds me of Jennifer Garner. Check it out.

action is constant.  Interesting view of/take on the job of CIA operatives, success because of individual initiative notwithstanding fed bureaucracy/politics.  entertained by careful mixing/balance of romance and personal relationship matters into action.  upbeat.

Covert Affairs is non-stop action with interesting caricatures and intense interplays of relationships.
I chose this series because I loved Alias with Jennifer Garner but I thought some of the actors in Alias were over played.  In Covert Affairs it seems to me that there is a right balance between Annie Walker (Piper Perabo) and her assignments, lovers and support personnel.  I want to watch every episode of every season...yes it is that good!  Action, intrigue and drama par excellence!  So what if borrows some of the plot patterns and traits of Alias and 24 it is still in a league of its own.  Watch it and you will see what I mean!

This is an enjoyable show, not always plausible but fun to watch if you are not too critical of reality.  There are interesting missions these agents engage in and the show keeps me engaged.  Addicted!

The action is never serious enough to be diconcerting and the byplay between the main characters is warm and fuzzy.  Unspoken yearnings and love between agents adds to the pleasure of watching this upbeat, techno comedy thriller.

This series is addictive!  Sure, some things are a bit far fetched, but ... it's TV!  Fantasy land.
I love the characters, and it always leaves the viewer in suspense ... dying to know what is going to happen next.
LOVE IT!

Enjoyable series with minimal violence, language and virtually no nudity. Love the characters and their relationships.
Hope Prime continued to offer additional seasons. I'm hooked!

I already rated this show, and my ideas haven't changed. We watch it because of the character development and likeable actors, but the main character, Annie Walker, seems to have more than a normal share of adventure/danger than most real agents might face. The most recent episode used a statistic that the CIA lost only 103 operatives over the past 65 years, as compared to the hundreds of thousands of lives lost in the armed services and tens of thousands of police across the country. This leads us to believe that a CIA agent's work is not quite what Annie experiences on a regular basis. Nevertheless, the show is good entertainment with interesting plots.
I had never heard of it but know I am hooked great spy series! Definitely worth watching very entertaining. Cant wait for season 4 to be on prime!
One of the better shows on TV. Started watching several seasons ago. Actors and actresses are very talented. Nice to be able to watch at any time.

Annie's story keeps me glued to every episode. My favorite guest star is Oded Fehr playing Eyal Lavine and let's not forget Auggie. I love the role he plays as a blind tech op head of his own division.

Well kudos to the writers of Covert Affairs.  I saw Piper Perabo and I thought, nah, she cant pull this off, well I was dead wrong.  From the the two married leaders and their troubled marriage and working relationship, to Jai, son of the ex head of covert ops, playing the game like a pro, to the developing relationship between Annie and Augie, the blind, brilliant, and crazy sexy, tech ops specialist.  Not since Chuck have I had such a nerd crush.  I cant wait until the romance launches, but until then, I savor all the lead ups, the venues, the tech stuff, go see the youtube video, on Covert Affairs, Annie and Augie, Here with You, it's hauntingly beautiful.
Interesting and kept me on the edge of my seat! Some episodes I watched twice because it was so good.
Fun for a break and true to locations and sites.  Good to unwind after a day at the office.  Good character development.
Show is exciting keeps you guessing the perfect mix of excitement danger and romance all in all a wonderful show

I love covert affairs.  Not only since Fiona from Burn Notice have I seen I woman that is smart and cunning as her.  Plus Piper has a sweet nature that really fools the bad guys.  It does not hurt that there are two extremely hot guys that go without shirts on the show also.  Great plot lines and acting.

The characters continue to grow their relationships to each other and Annie's innovative working with others involved on the cases has unique turns that sometime startle in effectiveness as well as her skills.
Can hardly stop watching it each night. Piper plays her part superbly. It's a lot of fun and you feel like you're getting a look at what goes on inside the intel agencies.
It's getting better with each episode and may soon be as good as Alias. I believe it will make the grade(I'm a RETIRED TEACHER)
Lots of twists and turns!  Great intrigue,  Helps while I am waiting for new episodes of Blacklist, Chicago Fire & PD
Good show keeps your attention, some of the graphics can get annoying with how fake looking they appear. All in all I would say its an interesting show with a good looking actress.

Season two continues with the same delightful characters.  In this season we learn more about the characters' private life away from the agency. The episodes become more exciting toward the second half of the season. Basically it's a feel good show. If you like light hearted spy stories add a star.  If you like intense thrillers subtract a star. I found it enjoyable.

Piper Perabo makes a great spy.  She's beautiful, she's expressive, fun to watch.  The stories are fairly realistic for the most part.  The pace is pretty good.

Really, the only negative notes on the show are the apparent aversion the main character has to carrying a gun *when she needs to be carrying one* and that the fictional CIA does apparently not have access to all the tools and technology that the real CIA has access to.

I highly recommend the whole series.

I think my issue is still Piper Perabo. I hate to use the word, unrealistic to describe this show, but allowance for entertainment factor aside, her heightening subordination without recourse is a bit annoying. Needless to say I still follow it, hence three stars.

I love covert affairs. Hot guy smart women with good hearts and fighting skills. I hope it goes for a few more seasons

I very much enjoy this show. It's smart, and sometimes funny, and just enough excitement. I started watching because Piper was in it. I've kept watching because its good! I think it'll be a sad day when I catch up on all the back episodes.

Explosively captivating, Season 2 is a season of loss and estrangement for Annie Walker. Jai Wilcox dies. Annie's sister's marriage falls apart. Annie and her sister are split over Annie's mysterious comings and goings. Field Ops become deadly. The action builds with each episode with Annie losing someone safe and secure with almost each episode. Finally she is left with only herself to rely on in the field and at Langley, where Joan seems hostile and Augie seems preoccupied.
It isn't really a "on the edge of your seat" thriller but has its catchiness. It can be a bit predictably cheesy but has its moments.
We love watching this exciting show.  It has lots of action, beautiful scenery in many amazing locations, and interesting plot twists.

Five stars for good personalities in the characters and constant action.
Is not overly unreal and keeps your attention with interesting story lines.

This show took me completely by surprise. It is excellent in every aspect: writing, directing, casting & acting, & even the music throughout is very well-chosen and well done. The storylines are exciting & packed with action and suspense and, at the same time, the development of the characters is just brilliant, very in-depth & extremely well-acted and well-played out. You really get to know the main characters and fall in love with them, both individually & them together. I also love the humor, which is very entertaining. Just the right amount & at the right times. Yet, as the seasons progress, the show is taken up a notch and becomes a lot more serious and still never ever ceases to amaze me. This show is incredible and the actors are incredible and I hope it keeps going for many seasons! There are several shows that I like a lot, but this is one of my all-time favorites so far. Thank you, all of you, who work so hard on this to bring us such brilliant entertainment. Consider me hooked.
LOVE COVERT AFFAIRS AND ANNIE WALKER . ONE OF THE BEST SHOWS ON USA. WRITING THEIR REVIEW IS A PAIN IN THE BUT THO.

I really enjoy this show, but do get tired that the producers persists in trying to make it a chick flic. Why cannot we have a secret agent how just happens to be female? Why must we put up with skin all over the place?
Does Benedict Cumberbatch display his chest in every episode of Sherlock?, No.
Does anyone wear cocktail dresses every day at work? No.
But every female on this show does. And that is what bothers me. The stories are great but the way the women are dressed is WRONG.
It is not that I do not enjoy watching beautiful women wearing less than they should. I just am saying dressing them in such fashion does not advance the story. Sorry.

I'm also torn about the decision to write out Annie's family.  On the one hand her relationship with her sister and nieces wasn't done very well, on the other that part of the story gave Annie a dimension she doesn't have any more.

I found that the sequences keep the pace of story-telling up to speed.  It has all the basics of protagonist/antagonist with a fresh antagonist each time but the same good looking girl protagonist.  Love interests are worked in every sequence but without any consequence of two individual intertwining their lives exactly.  Never-the-less the conflict mostly remains within the CIA organization.  Each of the actors is attractive and not necessarily sinister.
Sometimes strains credulity that one spy can do all this stuff from week to week.  After awhile, you just say "Oh well", sit back and go with the flow.
Great show about the struggles a agent goes through on a daily basis. Can't wait until other seasons become prime.

Overall the stories are all very predictable (I don't mind this because at the moment I just want something light to take my mind off things for a while).  It is the characters and their interactions with each other that make this such a great show.  They are very likable.

We find this show to be very enjoyable and engaging.  These spies are fine actors, highly attractive and engaging.  Some of the plots are more dense than others, and some have more twists.  The relationship with the sister is emblematic of how hard it is to have a normal life, and perhaps that is true of everyone in this modern society.  It's a strange job description to lie, trick, steal and sometimes maim or kill, and more perplexing that some of the characters attempt to keep their humanity whereas others appear to have closed their hearts.  Again this is emblematic of the human condition.  BTW I love the theme and the opening credits. It's good to look at these people with warmth in your heart.

Its a good story line. I am watching all the seasons and am holding out hope that the fight scenes get a little less cliche and tacky. And the editing gets better. The main character seems to LOSING confidence the more she does her job. Again its worth waiting for the story to continue but they are my current gripes about the show.

Love this show. Love amazon prime. I enjoy watching whole season to catch up!  My fav. Is suggest and Annie friendship

This is a fun, entertaining show. It strikes a good balance between character development, story, and action, without really overdoing any one key element. It does remind of "Alias," (but i never judge on originality) so if you liked that show, you'll probably enjoy this one too. The biggest difference I see between the 2 shows is this one seems a little more light hearted, which makes for a more relaxed viewing experience at the end of a work day, even though there are still plenty of intense action and chase sequences. Piper is a joy to watch and the rest of the cast is also great. I reserve 5 stars for the absolute best, so a 4 for me is still quite strong and highly recommended. Give it a shot!

I have seen three out of the four seasons that are on offer at present.  Season 5 is in production and will air the summer of 2014.
I enjoyed the first two seasons, because they were fairly plausible.  I guess I can be called a "purist" because I like it when there is some similitude between the truth and the deeds and actions.  For example, the heroine of the piece gets into a tight spot in a foreign country and then she is back at Langley and there is no explanation how she came so far so quickly.  Also, the military equipment has to be "right" i.e. vehicles and weapons should be the ones used by the countries that are portrayed.  Nothing puts me off more than to see Russian soldiers driving American trucks.  Still, that is just "me" I guess.  There is action galore and suspense by the bucket!  The story is moving all the time, so from that standpoint, it is very entertaining.  You find yourself having to catch your breath after each of the break-neck pursuits.  Those are the bits that I would give 5 Stars to.  Now, the bad news:  Where it really falls down is the main character herself.  She is undisciplined and has little respect for authority.  She goes her own way, against direct orders and consequently gets her backside in a sling most of the time.  She always has to rely on others to get her out of the scrapes she creates, most of which were totally avoidable.  She gets other people killed unnecessarily because of her being a loose cannon.  And, by the time you get to season three, the predicaments she gets into are infuriating and the escapes become more and more unlikely.  After three seasons, a lot of the tension is gone because you know this Mata Harri is going to get through it all no matter how great the odds or unlikely the success of the rescue plans.  There are at least a half a dozen times in the series when she should have been shot dead without any doubt if this was real life and yet, she gets away!  If this young lady worked for me, I would give her a job in the company canteen, chain her to her position, allowing her to only leave for potty breaks!  I won't be watching season 4 or 5, because I can already guess what is going to happen.  They have to keep re-working the murdery bits and the intrigues between the characters.  To the plus side of the ledger:  The cast is very good and you feel a rapport with the main characters, which is what happens when the actors do a good job.  This series is hugely popular, having its own website and ways of following your favorite characters.  If you are able to overlook the many and obvious short comings and keep telling yourself "remember, this is only telly" then you will pass many enjoyable evenings, because each season is 16 episodes.  For my account, though, I have had enough.
This season, like all other seasons, was very entertaining. This show has passion beyond belief. The cast us mesmorizing and are truly great actors.
If you like White Collar your gonna like this!  They really bring you in to the story and get you to care about the characters.
