This show has a few things going for it. Piper Perabo (playing the principle character: 'Annie' Walker) is very sexy, and the producers aren't afraid to show her in some sexy clothing and poses that make me... Christopher Gorham (playing 'Augie' Anderson) is also quite sexy (for the ladies) and once again the revealing outfits and workout scenes are abundant. The costumes, locations, sets and props are superb. It's a very stylish show, with high production value. The music (especially the title track by Flint Eastwood) is killer and the overall production value superb.  The problem with this show? The writing; specifically the portrayal of the CIA (and other intelligence agencies). The show routinely shows CIA agents conducting covert ops inside the U.S., targeting U.S. persons for ops, breaking various laws, acting in irresponsible and illegal ways. Their interaction with other intelligence agencies is always competitive, antagonistic and marked by direct competition. The ignorance (or is it disinformation?) regarding U.S. intelligence agencies (do five minutes of research on Google, why don't you?!) is disturbing, insulting, and distracting. The acting ranges from fair to downright abysmal - If Christopher Gorham is supposed to play a blind person why is he constantly dodging furniture, doorways and objects directly in his path? Is the director awake during the shoot? I don't think I'll make it beyond season two. It's fun to watch for a season or two (I saw season one as well), but ultimately this show will run out of steam.
I like the lighthearted feel of this Spy drama! Covert Affairs is a less seedy version of Le Femme Nikita.

As a member of the general public, I have no idea whether this series bears any resemblance to real Agency practices or personnel -- I have to assume it probably does not. Annie Walker does what I would consider some dumb things with a lack of foresight, and she certainly is not inconspicuous. However, it's a television drama, not a documentary, and it's fun to watch. I appreciate the character's quick thinking in various situations, her comfort with languages and in several different countries and the behind-the-scenes departmental intrigue; however, this appears to take over the show later in the season, which takes away some of the appeal for me.

Season 2 offers the same high quality stories and characters as season 1, plus takes the viewers to more foreign locales. Annie Walker's life becomes more complicated when she decides to tell her sister, Danielle, that she's not really working for the Smithsonian, but the CIA. Her sister reacts badly, kicking Annie out of her guest house. In the season finale, Danielle accidentally becomes involved in one of Annie's missions and sees first hand how great her sister performs as a field operative. The truth behind the Ben Mercer character is explained and gets resolved. Auggie gets romantically involved with the younger sister of one of his deceased Army Special Forces buddies, and Jai Wilcox starts showing characteristics of his less than honorable father and former Director of Clandestine Services, now directed by Arthur Campbell. Jai deceives many in the CIA and his father in order to climb the ladder within the agency. As always, there are plenty of stories and plot twists.
Characters are easy to identify with-- yet there is enough ooh & aah out of the everyday to make it fun. Believable scenarios-- with good character development.

My wife enjoyed watching season two of Covert Affairs on Amazon Prime.  I don't think I would have enjoyed this on TV, as you can tell when they are cutting to commercial. This show is entertainment. As long as you watch it to be entertained, it is worth your time. We have watched the first 3 season's and each season is better then the last.
Lots of fun. If you like Alias, White Collar or Bones, I think you'll like this show for it's fun and whimsy.
Season 2 had me on the edge of my seat. I love how each episode leaves viewers hungry for more. Awesome!
Everything about this show is better during the second season. Finished streaming Season 2 and looking forward to the next.
Love Annie Walker!  Good stories, well written! Good cast.  I would recommend it. Watched it on Amazon Prime. Waiting for series on TV.
the locations are great!----she has great legs!----stories worth the time-I would like amazon to add 2013 on prime.as soon as available thank you!
Love the story line.  Lots of action.  Love the fact that shows are filmed in a world wide setting!  Great Job.
The plot twists and turns. Unexpected, addictive and never disappointing. The great character development is the winner here for this show.
Loved the Annie and Ogie character. Highly recommended! If you love suspense and actions this is your series to watch.
I love watching the series from the beginning.  Watched season 1 and season 2 - already on season 3 looking forward to season 4 - might have to DVR not free on prime yet. :(
No I remember why I watch this show.  It in unfortunate that later seasons are not as good. Hopefully they will get back to this format soon.
I really like this program, and the story line on each episode is done very well.  The characters play their parts well.  I can't wait to get to the next season.
One episode per day.  Wonderful entertainment!!  Piper does an excellent performance as Annie.  You will enjoy this show.  I wish I had her energy.
I am hooked on Covert Affairs.  Each episode kept me on the edge of my seat and anxious to see the next!
Love this show, it is interesting and always engaging. You won't be disappointed by the acting or the story line at all!
I totally LOVE covert affairs! I'm hooked till the very end! I can't wait to find out what's coming next!!!
I Really enjoy watching this show ot great and entertaining.  Something different.  I recommend it even if you don't like spy shows.

The first season drew me in and this second season has not disappointed. The characters have become more real, still glamorized, but fleshed out a bit.  I'm looking forward to the third season, and Love Amazon prime(and Roku)!
Enjoy action and intrigue? Get it here. Light encounters and confrontations with magical solutions. Fun for all. 3 more words.

I've enjoyed the series.  I haven't followed it on TV, so it's great to be able to watch the episodes in order, rather than to catch an episode here and there on reruns.  Can't wait for the next season to be available on Prime.
I love this show! I can't wait for the season to start back up this week! Good plot, very believable, and love the on location shooting.
Great drama. Very interesting story about the life of a CIA operative. Characters show more maturation and plot lines have gotten interesting

With Season 2 the producer started adding words that were unnecessary and toward the second half of the season some bed scenes were thrown in.  The plots were pretty good without the extras.  The character 'Annie' was fresher during the first half when she was sweet and fun loving.  She and 'Auggie" do well together.  Both are likeable characters. Looking forward to next season.

I wasn't too impressed with the first season. The second season seems to work better. I'd like to see more depth to the bad guy's characters. Otherwise it's simply good guys versus bad guys, much too simple.
I think the show is well.....lame, but the wife likes it.  After serving twenty years in the military, this just goes a little bit overboard.
Full of action and adventure as always. Season 2 keeps delivering the action adventure and Annie grows into her element.
We loved season 1 and were not disappointed with season 2.  The series continues to be fresh and exciting.  The characters revel more of themselves.  On to season 3!

For those of us who lived in D.C., the location shots there are great fun!  We also loved the storyline locations in far away places, such as Morocco.  The shows are really shot there.
The main characters are sympathetic and evolve as the seasons progress. Good time!
It is captivating, without much violence and there is a story behind each episode. It is exciting to watch as it ends well.

I'm an action/adventure,S/F kinda guy. A lot of the action is fast but a little contrived. There is very little in the way of science, a lot of fiction. Piper is really fun to look at. Your high fashion,high maintenance, cover girl. But nobody in their right mind would even try some of those stunts in a tight dress and spike heels. The story line is like a paperback romance novel. If that's your thing, your going to love it.

I like the way Annie gets things done, even without a gun at times.  I also like the husband and wife team that direct her work.  I enjoy their relationship.  Her sister is her best friend - like mine is.  That tugs at my heart.  Toward the end of the 2nd season, some of the scenes became more predictable.
This  series is very good, it was so enjoyable to watch and I was where 5 could hardly wait to see what the next show would be about.  Loving this whole series.

This series is one of the best of this kind of excitement dramas.  Amazon's digital copy is flawed by starts, stops and jumps.  It is short also of the integrity of the first series which set a standard in directing, photography and acting.  I solved my problem by skipping to the third season series.
Watch the first three seasons on Prime... It was exciting and couldn't wait to watch the next episode. I'm bummed that I cannot watch Season 4 free :(

I started watching the show the first season and then was unable to continue due to work committments.  I am now playing catch-up to see how Annie has evolved.  I believe she has grown into her role in the Agency very well.  I also find it fascinating what Ms. Perabo can do in impossibly high heels!  She probably is not actually wearing those in scenes where they are showing her from the waist up.  I am now starting on Season 3.  I have a slow satellite internet service so can only watch in the middle of the night.  Don't do it too often but if I do, I usual make a marathon of it and watch 3 or 4 shows at a time.  I am very glad that I am able to see this series for free as part of my Amazon Prime membership.  Since I am now retired and on a very limited budget, I am glad that this is offered.
Not sure why I didn't watch this on TV, but find it interesting, funny and it keeps me coming back to see what will happen next. Have really enjoyed streaming this on the computer.
This is a great drama. Smart and beautiful leading lady with lots of suspense, cool technology, and a great story line! All seasons are good- watch them!!

I like the diversity of the different plots.  Nice twists and starting to relate to the characters.  However, starting to see subliminal liberal antidotes inserted in the story line, but not a flagrante as other series.  I guess the reality that Hollywood is nothing but a propaganda arm of the Progressive and Democratic party should not be such a surprise - but it certainly is disheartening.  Can't you just have a series free from Progressive indoctrination and brainwashing?  Hopefully next season it won't get worse.
Similar to other viewers. I love la femme Nikita, and really liked Alias and Covert Affairs season 1 & 2. Just started season 3 and already like what I've seen so far.
This is a very enjoyable series and keeps you on the edge.of your seat. Never a dull moment with lots of twists and turns and I think it has a good cast and some interesting relationships.
It nice to see a spy drama that doesn't feature the infallible James Bond type character in the staring role.  Lots of action and somewhat believable
better than season 1 and still better than season 1, now they need 10 more words. four more, ok, done.
It is fun looking at a beautiful young woman who is intelligent and always tough, but the episodes are repetitive and it gets progressively more repetitive.  A bit empty.

I love action, suspense with a little romance mixed in. Piper is always breaking the rules and taking risks to make things right. A little Jamie Bondish at times and it works well for her. More the romance part than expert at fancy gadgets, but she makes you want to see what happens next. Great show
Each episode is very well done.  The characters are fleshed out and you feel like you know them.  Fun series.
Same review.  Can't wait for the next season to start.  Wish it would go immediately to Amazon Prime (for free).  Don't like the commercials interrupting everything on TV.
I watch available seasons can't wait foe the next one. Getting amozo prime is great but they don't release the seasons for free soon enough
Sean two is just as good as season one. Many series loose my interest after season one but this keeps me coming back for more.
Great show!  All actors are perfect for their roles - casting did great. The fact the show takes you all over the world is definitely a bonus.

Great series!!! Love all the characters and story line -- especially Auggie Anderson!!!
First three seasons are entertainingly good! Enjoy!
The episodes are fun, very action packed. The quality of the images on my Kindle are great! Would recommend it.
seasons 1 and 2 were better than the next....  some of the prediciments she gets in are way too predictable
This is a very good seried. I would watch an entire season in one weekend. we couldn't stop watching. The characters are wonderful.
Exciting episodes that keep our attention. Great characters and actors! Don't necessarily have to watch the episodes in order to follow along, so that keeps the show refreshing!
Love the characterizations, especially Auggie. The interplay between him and Annie is great. One of the most addictive shows we've seen.
We really enjoyed watching Covert Affairs. We can't wait for the coming seasons to be released. We'll definitely buy them too.
Covert Affairs, lst season was okay, I thought maybe 2nd season would have more grit - but it is just entertaining. Nothing great but I will finish watching the next seasons off and on
Love this series and had a hard time quitting as I decided to watch so many a night to make it last longer.  I am now on series 4  but dreading the end.  Hopefully they have season 5.

I see this only because the story is very solid.
but, I hate piper, she acts  like a prom girl acting as a CIA agent. she is really unfit. she makes it look like a comedy show.

OK for killing time but not the best spy show. Not a 24.
Looks more like an Alias knock-off. Average

I rated this a 5 star for several reasons:  the characters are great in their parts; it offers believable situations; and while serious, there are moments of humor.  Also, nice to watch a show that isn't overkill with violence.

Got hooked on this series and fell in love with the characters.  I can't get enough...
Great "binge watch".
Try it out... each week has an interesting mission, and the on-going plot line is good too.
If you like season 1 of Covert affairs, you'll like season 2 also. Anne Walker will not disappoint you again!
Fast paced, good plots.  Waiting for Amazon to stop teasing us prime members with free seasons but when your hooked making us pay for every new episode
The most interesting thing about this show is the blind agent. I made myself finish the second season but not interested enough to watch the third season.

i like the actors and the plot and yes I would recommend this show
There is nothing I do not like about this show
I really did not get into the show on TV. No time. But now wit it on  Amazon, I can watch when I want to. The show is very interesting and I am hooked. I love the main characters.

The first season starts with Annie being light hearted and innocent which I like. As the seasons progress Annie becomes darker and hell bent on revenge which makes me less interested in her character. The show is fun to watch, but I am starting to lose interest.
Covert Affairs is easy to watch and entertaining. I enjoy the chase and trying to figure out the ending. I like that it is not over the top with violence and nudity.

Show is well written  with many twists and turns. Each episode ends with a cliff hanger that has you accessing the next episode immediately. The best part of this show is that is included free with Amazon Prime. Hope that season 4 will be included free with Amazon Prime

I love this show! Piper. Parabo is one of my favorite actresses. She's like a female Jason Bourne, but still learning. I'm sure Jason Bourne wasn't the badass that he was in the movies from the start.
Overall it was okay.  I didn't fully understand the sudden 'cold shoulder' Jai was given.  He seemed to be well accepted in season one.

This is a well written and fast-moving  action series.  The characters are interesting and there are good side- stories. The addition
of a blind analyst adds  a nice  dimension . I recommend this series for good solid entertainment.  I was happy  to see "Coupling's"
Jeffery in a non comedy setting.
.
Bad acting, worse writing. Very much surprised there is a season two or more. Not worth the time to watch.

I am really enjoying watching this show on Amazon.  I like the fact that the lead character is a quick thinking take charge female CIA operative.  There is action and suspense.  I enjoy the whole cast of characters.
The plot is getting better. Annie is started to develop relationships with other assets. I am starting to like it.
Good story not too techy and language is really good (no swearing or cussing). And everything is kept in a interesting notion you want to keep going.
I love Piper she is great. I have liked her since Coyote Ugly.  Love the situations that she gets into and out of, THE BOMB. I love the views of DC . A very good show
Great character interaction and story line.  Watched all the episodes one right after another and now can't wait for the new season to start.
Love the actors and the story line, always entertaining and exciting.  Been following this show from the begining.  Like the twists and turns of each show.
Great series.  Love all the characters and variety of episodes.  Each episode seems to  add to the character development.  Ready to start 3
Sexy excitement! Good actors and well written stories.  My husband likes it also.  A show we can watch together.  We also like Burn Notice, Suits, and White Collar

I don't watch much TV but I found this show on Amazon Prime and I love it! The characters are great and there is always a wonderful story line. I kind of feel like this show is my guilty pleasure that I get to watch after the kids go to bed.
Love a good spy and/or detective show, this one has it all, good action and intrigue. Piper Perabo plays a good character.
Particularly like the increased emphasis on Auggie's role in Season 2.  Still a little hard to believe the sister can't figure out there is something going on, though
Very Intriguing...Loved It, Hope It continues.  The International episodes Are Most Exciting.  Very Good Acting. Keep Up Good Work.  thanks
This is a very addictive, exciting show.  It is set on exotic, faraway locales and has very endearing characters.  The story line is entertaining.

This show certainly isn't the best on tv or even in the top ten, but if you want something that is mildly entertaining it is a good choice it will keep you interested, but not on the edge of your seat.

I did not know about that serie until I picked it up season one on a shelf in a store.  I was hooked right away and have been watching 4 episodes per night. I never watch tv so I cant wait to get season 3 ASAP.
It is funny, fast and we visit the world. And, all the actors/actresses are good looking.
Fun show. You can't take the show too seriously, but the actors and actresses are top notch and make it a good show.

The combination of characters makes this a worth watching series.  Ms Perabo is a flirtacious cutie who is supported by a handsome, very technically capable blind guy.  They both work for a seriously stern but fair boss (who by the way is quite hot) who keeps CIA mission first, but her people a close second.  A touch of family as Ms Perabo's character lives with her married with kids sister who do not know what she really does for a living.
I Really Enjoy This Series. It's Well Acted And Always A Lot Of Fun To Watch. The Cast Is Fantastic!
Good action show, although a little far fetched at times.  Nice blend of action, romance and anticipation. Look forward to Season 3.

I  found this series  and season to be one of the best TV series in a long time. It took me a long time before I went to  my kindle and watched this series. I would recommend folks who live-action and  travel to get hooked on Covert  Affairs.

The show has a lot of action you won't get bored. Piper Perabo is real good, the only thing ofr a spy she never changes her look to help her hide form the bad guys that know her. You'd think when under cover for a job she'd change her look.
This series, was addicting.  Again the action, the drama, the action continues.  Really enjoyed Piper Perabo, in her role as a spy.
The characters didn't grab my interest but the show provided some light entertainment. While this isn't 24 it is kinda fun.
I really did enjoy Covert Affairs Season 2...and i liked the First Season so now look forward to Season 3

Covert Affairs is exciting. I love strong female action figures, and Annie Walker (Piper Perabo) certainly qualifies. The rest of the cast, especially blind tech expert Augie, are very strong, too.

The CIA of the series is a cutthroat place with many subplots and a lot of infighting, many ops going on inside the US despite the official charter restricting them to working elsewhere. That much is reasonably genuine, but the altruistic and genuinely patriotic main characters are probably much too 'hice' compared to the real thing.

I tend to blame the real CIA for everything from the death of JFK to the assorted false flag operations that threaten to turn our country into a police state. I should hate any series that makes them look good. But...I don't. I thoroughly enjoy watching Covert Affairs. So it must be pretty darn good!
The show is still going strong and getting better. Love the way they do on site filming in foreign countries.
The acting is pretty good, and the plot lines are interesting and don't feel formulaic. A good show to pass the time
My kids ands in I finished watching the whole season in three days.  Only a great show can capture our attention like this.
Action filled, good story line with a sexy female spy! Could not wait for the next episode to begin. A must watch series!
I recommend this series and hope for many more seasons.  I love the global locations and web of intrigue.  There are characters that you love and those you want to punch in the face.
Great plot. Each show is fantastic. Well worth watching. Keeps your attention and each new show seems to get better than the last one.
I fell in love with this show and have now caught up to current show on tv. I love it.
The episodes are exciting and intriguing, very clear.  I would recommend this series to anyone who is interested in this type of entertainment.

So much on TV these days does not interest us.  We had never watched Covert Affairs until recently, and we got it on Amazon Prime.  It's a great show, lots of action, nothing offensive (language and violence), but plenty of action and geographical areas (Paris, Moscow, the islands, etc.).  Try it, you'll like it.
Love this series one of my favs,Easy to follow,not to complex but plenty of twists and turns to keep your interest.

The episodes in this season build upon each other more than in Season One, so it can be important to watch them in order.

I enjoy the characters (however unrealistic) and the plot lines...and always want to know where Annie or Joan got there clothes for each episode.
I love action movies, especially when the lead character is a female.  I have always admired Piper Perabo as well.

If you're not a fan of action or humorous one liners, then this show is not for you. It's creative and entertaining with just enough drama to keep you interested. The acting is decent and it has different characters for anyone to fall in love with. If you're a real critic I wouldn't recommend it but if you're just looking for something to watch, its perfect.
Great series, but she needs to have and use a gun! Unrealistic that she would run all these missions without a firearm.  Other than that, great acting and series!
Just watch it.  You'll like it.  Good ensemble cast.  Great action.  On par with Alias.  Gets better as series progresses.

I've started the series this summer on Netflix then on Amazon...Can't wait for the next season.  Well written, believable most of the time.  The fight scenes seem realistic where she gets banged up a little, but stubbornly carries on.  Strong women in a male dominated profession.  I especially enjoy the twists and turns of the plots where you never know who to trust.  The medical scenes could use an advisor, and are not very accurate.
I like this series and waiting for the next season.  This is a female version of James Bond....or close to it.  I found the characters very interesting and I wanted to keep watching.  love it!

keeps me awake and enjoying every minute
One of my favorite shows. It will be yours too.
try it today
dj
Great series, lots of intrigue, twists, and exciting scenes. Never sure how it will end. Wonderful quirky characters. Do not want  it to end.

Same as season 1: Action is good, story plots good and like the multiple stories. Some of the acting is not so good, but that is understandable as it is shot in Canada and you get what you pay for.
It does wrap up the story lines a bit to quickly.
It would be nice to do a story line over multiple episodes, could get a bit more meat out of it.
Love,Love, Love this show!!!  I wish they had the current season on Amazon Prime free also!!!!  It is very action packed.
I love spy shows but I also like a little fun in the characters. I would recommend this show highly!
Larger budget than most TV series.  Good acting. Refreshing.  Piper is pleasant to watch.  Another view of the CIA that may or may not be true but it's entertaining
Great Show that has improved from the first season.  Builds on all aspects of characters from first season.  Gets better with each episode.

I'm watching Season 3 now and look forward to 4 & 5.

I like Auggie very much.  He is so sweet and funny, clever and devoted to Annie.  That being said, I really don't like the romance between Annie and Auggie.  They are so wonderful as best friends.

This is a sort of 24 - ish type show.  It has a lot of action, adventure and intrigue.
Awesome season. I love the show. I have seasons one , two and three. I will be getting season four when it comes out.
I think this show gets better every season. Love watching the episodes from Amazon ... no commercials!  Give it a watch!
If you enjoy watching spy shows, you will like this one.  It is full of action and involves all the characters.
Great cast, great (realistic) story lines, which keep you guessing.  Overall a great show, which (at least for me) makes work at 'the Agency' seem like a heck of a lot of fun!!
Good blend of soft and hard in the main character.  Love the intra and inter agency storylines. Engaging story where you watch one after the other because you have too
I was hooked from the first episode. Great entertainment if you like mystery , action and a good story line.
This is one of my favorite shows...I will be watching it over and over!  it will be the most used video on my kindle!
I loved every minute of it.  Am currently watching season three.  And watching season four on tv.  Fantastic relationship between all the characters.
Ok show, just doesn't hold your attention. I find myself doing other things like listening to music or Binging the Internet while CA plays in the background.
My husband and I enjoy the plots and all of the characters in the series.  We watch each night after the news.

Very entertaining! Reminds me of 24 but with a strong female "Jack Bauer".  The scenery is beautiful in the different countries that the missions call Annie to go to.  The relationships between the characters is getting more involved. LOVE IT!!
I enjoy the main part of this show well enough (CIA spy show).  The really good character is Joan, and it is fun to watch the interplay between her and her husband.
I'm always on the edge of my seat when I watch this show -- I love action packed tv shows.

Its what you expect from a show of this sorts.  A little redundant in the shows story line, but cute to watch.  Would like to see more depth of a story line but maybe it will get going as I am completing the second series going onto the third.
Enjoy it

It has action from start to finish. Keep you on on the edge of your seat.

Covers many different countries, so you get a good glimpse of the outside world.
Kind of lame and not believable for the stories they air.  Watched some of the first season on cable, Glad I was able to catch an episode on season 2 to see that I don't miss it.

I have enjoyed the character development and the overall theme.
more shows like this would be a plus to anyone's collection
Had no idea what this series was about, so I checked it out.  I couldn't stop watching and can't wait for more.

I don't have tv service, and haven't for years, so I've missed most tv series in the past decade. I've been watching this one on Amazon Prime, and love it. I'll be sad when I've seen every episode! Very likable characters with intelligence and interesting personalities combined with interesting plots combining adventure, drama, suspense and comedy into a package that is very enjoyable!

This series is getting better each show. Stories don't change a lot, but seemingly the locations do.
Likeable characters that grow on you, with a good backstory.
Loving it :) cat wait to finish this season 2 so I can move on to the next season 3. :)))
Great writers and cast usually lead to a great show.  So far I'm interested enough to watch one after another.
I enjoyed this series, it had a lot of action and held my interest!  My husband also enjoyed it, too.
Couldn't wait to view each episode.  Intriguing.  Love every aspect of the show.  Piper is excellent as Annie Walker  Love Auggie
I really enjoyed this show.  I watched it on Amazon Prime.  It is well worth it.  The actors are great in it.
Even better than the first season.. Love how the characters have been developed... Overall the show pulls the viewers in
Nice show. Fun characters. Annie is a babe and Augie is excellent. Suspension of disbelief required as with most TV.

It's not a spy show like 24 or Alias as the violence is less 'violent' and occurs less often.  However this absence doesn't impact the suspense ratio as the character development and interplay is well written and acted. There is an ongoing and interesting underlying story line but each episode stands on it's own start and finish. It is at times cute, witty, romantic, adventurous, intriguing and exciting. If you're looking for deep heavy drama...you will find it here on occasion but the general 'atmosphere' of the show is lighter but nonetheless very entertaining. There is some impressive acting, directing and production throughout making this palatable fare for watching and liking.
Seeing a few commercials were enough to get my attention. Started at season 1 and watched until I was current.  How did I miss this on tv?
This show is a fun watch. The production values are good and the actors competent. It's a spy show that doesn't take itself too seriously - think Alias-light.
I love this show.  It keeps moving forward with new story lines, but maintains the relationships among the characters so you are always guessing.  Never a dull moment.
Most of the characters are enjoyable and relatable a few of "vilians" are a little over the top and less believable.

Totally addicted to this show! So glad on Amazon Prime! Already in 3rd season & I will be sad when I get to the final season! :-( Like a good book! I just can't stop. There was only one episode in season 2 I didn't care for as it was slowly paced, which is unusual for this program. All in all, it's worth the watch!!
Worth watching, fun and not too serious. Like the characters and the story line. Each episode has enough difference to be exciting.

The plots are not well developed and are some times it's hard to believe that Annie Walker is that tough.  But the casting is good  with interesting chemistry between them. Maybe a little less of Annie's home life with her sister would improve the flow of action.
This is a great spy movie.  It has romance and lots of action.  The story plots are varied and well done.
Love this show. Good writing and awesome locations around the world.

A girl who is beautiful, smart, tough, sexy, with heavy on the smart.
A genius who is blind but sees every aspect of every situation.
A supervisor who would make any man want to run away from home.
What's not to like?
Interesting characters, with a plot that twists and turns, with good pacing to create  emotional tension for the viewer. Very enjoyable and entertaining.

Very entertaining. Gives us a glimpse of the pre-Home Security Agency era
when every agency compete with each other. Congrats!
The wife and I came upon this series by accident.  At first we just watched it to watch something but we seriously got sucked in.  Good stuff!
Seemingly ripped from the headlines. Helps viewers understand there are real people who have personal lives. Easy burn through a whole season wanting to know what will happen next.

Plots lines that twist and turn, people almost believable, [almost because we are so accustomed to principles and ideals being compromised with circumstantial ethics that we find what we want to believe distant from what we see], this is 40 minutes of a quick read of adventure novella on film.
What could go wrong with a leggy blonde  .....  Blind back up, and a supporting cast of seasoned professionals?  This is a MUST SEE series that will steal your heart.
I love the characters and how they interact with one another. The actors paly off each other in a great fashion.
Season 2 hit the right balance between fun and serious with a female Bond figure.  I enjoyed it very much.
Piper Perabo is perfect in this role. I'm really glad that amazon offers this show as part of prime. Too bad I have to pay for the newest episodes, but I do because it's one of my favorite.

Seasons 1 and 2 were pretty entertaining.  The storyline about a young enthusiastic person becoming a big-time CIA agent was a nice story.  Some things were kind of implausible - like the head of the CIA is married to one of his directors, etc.  But the story is a decent premise.

Covert Affairs is excellent programming.  The characters are very original, and credible people.  I especially like Annie and Auggie and their friendship is refreshing.  The plots are generally good.  Occasionally, Annie is sort of out of this world strong like when she pushed a big attacker off of the boat in a recent episode.
Very cute show piper Peabo fun to watch. Love watching while working out. Give it a shot. Lots of fun
Great show. Adds to previous great season! I hope tgr next seasond are even better than this and the last one.
Like the spy stuff as well as the interpersonal relationships. It's never predictable.  The international locals are fun to see too.
My husband & I both enjoyed this show and are hoping it continues for a while! Not one to watch with kids, though.

I love my Covert Affairs! I just started watching this series.
So had to order to see what I missed.

Normally a show about a hot chick who works as a spy (typical low budget Hollywood B-movie) wouldn't interest me. But what the heck... on a lazy summer day with nothing else to do I decided to give it a shot. Surprisingly well written and a great acting cast. The story line will keep you invested, and looking forward to the next episode.

If you like the Plum series you will like this show. The lead is CIA, but never carries a gun. Beware that just like the Plum novels it gets old in that the plots are all pretty much the same.  Watch a few for good entertainment, but after a while you will get bored.

I thought the plot was a bit contrived.  Too much action and too little thought.  Cute ideas like Ukrainians who love chocolate and agents who know swear words, and only swear words...  Not impressed.
Particularly interesting these days in light of all the news about Government intelligence collecting. Surprising plot twists keep one coming back for more.
Watchable series that entertains and is believable.  Like the idea of Washington being the "home base" of the series as we lived in that area.  Entertaining but not a lot of blood & guts.
Good enough to keep me watching. Nothing spectacular though. Later seasons do get better. As a spy thriller, there are better options. This is more drama than thriller.
but... i want Auggie and Annie to be together already!! I can see how they flirt and he gave her a car!!!!
I enjoy the action, characters and lead, Ms Perabo, very much. An ingenue, female spy with all the right moves.
A good all around show similar in some ways to Alias.  Every now and then a cheesy scene.  Wish she would get a gun, though.

Attention griping.  Drama.. Action.  We have enjoyed every season available. Recommend it to everyone. Very good.  Each episode makes you want to watch the next one

If you're looking for an interesting action adventure tv show, this is the one! The characters are great and the mystery is just enough to keep your interest without making you nervous (although it's always nice to sit on the edge of your seat every once in a while and this show does that as well!). From the very first episode of season one I was hooked. Get to know Annie, the CIA operative who never completed her training, never uses a gun, and never fails at catching the bad guy. At least not yet. August (aka Auggie), Joan, Jay, and Arthur are definitely characters who compliment this series! Highly recommended for those who love spies!

This series is interesting to watch.  The lead character is a CIA agent, but unlike other spy series she rarely carries a gun.  Which is refreshing, since she often uses her wits as opposed to a shoot out to resolve problem situations.  Of course that's not to say that there aren't others who use guns,so bullets still fly regularly.  Even so, series has a few good twists, and often deals with some of the ethical dilemmas faced by the agents.  Good storylines.

My girlfriend and I watched the first 3 seasons in two weeks. I didn't think much of it but I actually really like it. It's highly entertaining and the characters are well developed. I can't think of the agents name but she's always kicking someone's ass or she's getting saved. She's perfect for the role. The show is believable and that makes it effective and entertaining to me.
This series has been fun to watch. It has both action and drama not to mention that I like all the characters.
Love the characters, and that is complex enough to be engaging, but not ridiculously involved, vulgar,or needlessly weighty or violent. Highly recommended.

This is a thrilling tv series that I started watching before I cut cable off.  I use some of the money I save not paying for cable to buy this and one other tv program that I missed after I cut off cable.  To say more would be to give spoilers to those not yet invested but should try it.

Season 2 of Covert Affairs offers not only additional adventures from the "files" of CIA operative Annie Walker, but also a chance to get to know her better. Her sister finds out she's really an operative and for the safety of the sister's children orders Annie to move out. This season reveals a maturing Annie as both person and operative, and digs deeper into the political machinations of Annie's bosses and co-workers. Twists and turns abound!

So it's like a Twinkie: you know you shouldn't, you know you are getting zero nutrition, but you pop it into your mouth anyway.  It's just enjoyable, even if it is embarrassing to say so.

Annie Walker's character is developing into something I think is taking away from the charm and appeal of the series. Her character has not previously been presented as that of a highly skilled fighter/killer -- this is not a direction I find particularly inviting -- however, as the characters of Augie and Eyal (sp.) have matured, they have preserved the true human element that the series offered early on. While Annie seems to be developing into a hardened spy, her counterparts have remained easier to identify with. Earlier in the series and this season her belief in good and right and integrity has been replaced with jetsetting, globe trotting, and a bit of unbelieveable just hopping on a plane at her whim -- to go wherever she feels the need to go -- I find this odd as there does not seem to be an accountability -- she is now a full blown spy who operates outside of any structure. It is just not building the character the way she started -- which I did like.

I have watched Seasons 0ne, two and three, all have been entertaining and I enjoy.  Impact, not so much - - it's just a nice CIA/SPY show and Piper Perabo does a good job in her roll. What should you know - - Its a nice show to watch!

Covert Affairs has become a favorite.  Watching the growth of the main character, Annie Walker, from a naive and idealistic rookie agent to a more world weary, disillusioned experienced operative is especially fascinating.  Piper Perabo has grown this character in a very realistic way and the story lines and writing continue to be intelligent, relevant and deep.  Can't wait for Season 3 and 4.

The first season of Covert Affairs was descent but my biggest complaint was that the show seemed to wrap up and complete the mission way to quickly in the end - in like the last 60 seconds of the show which seemed very anti-climactic.  The other issue I have with the main character Annie, is that she's a spy that's put in a lot of dangerous situations but never has a gun when every other spy she encounters does and is often caught up in gun fights every show.  It's a glaring short-coming or done purposely, either way it's not believable.  There is good build up to the end of the show but the way the show was scripted for the main character (Annie) to complete her mission was lacking something.  I think the show has a good premise but the writing just needs to be a little bit better. In Season 3 it appears they've gotten those better writers so it's even better than S2.  Over all it has good acting and good characters and plots but it's just missing something to put it over th top as a great show.  I don't like that they killed off a great main character this season.

Each seasons just keeps on getting better!

This series is awesome.  As a female "James Bond", Annie Walker is a compelling, strong female character.  The series nicely balances action and intrigue and exotic locales with human drama around passion and emotional struggles and relationships in general.  Auggies's character is also interesting: nice to see a disabled character in a key role. And Eyal (Oded Fehr) is just about sexiest actor on tv!  What is there not to love about this series?!

Annie Walker is a new CIA covert agent who gets involved in international assignments. As typical of this genre, she is not very respectful of authority and often acts beyond her orders. Annie has a close and increasingly romantic involvement with her handler, Auggie, who used to be a special ops officer who was blinded from an explosion. The episodes are generally well written, with multiple themes involving the various characters.

Plus: interesting characters and relationships, international locations (probably mostly green screened, but still adds interest).
Cons: as expected, a bit implausible at times. Not nearly as complex as a show like AMC's "The Killing" but good for the USA Network.

The love angles are beginning to overshadow the show, which is not good.  These love stories are causing the show to become somewhat ridiculous because it seems as if they are constructing the covert story lines around the love angles rather than the other way around.
It's not rocket science but the players are attractive and there is enough of a story line to keep up our interest.
The show is fun to watch and it keeps you guessing. The character development is excellent. Our only disappointment was the killing off if a couple characters that we wanted to see more.

I watched my first episode of this spy genre TV series and was pleasantly surprised.  It had decent plot lines and was very watchable.  I'll have to watch a few more episodes before I make a firm judgement, but I'm intrigued.
This is a great program and series which keeps you on the edge of you seat at all times. I highly recommend it.
I like this show because even though sometimes people die, for the most part the violence is kept minimal. It is exciting and keep you on the edge of your seat good!

The perfect show for binge watching on a lazy day. Annie and Augie always provide entertainment and adventure. Long term story lines add texture to the weekly episodes. It is unlike other shoot-em-up spy stories as  Annie uses her head and her skills whenever possible. Moral issues abound in a realistic manner: how foes Annie tell her sister that she is an operative?  What is patriotism and what is politics? How does ambition drive choices? Piper Perabo plays it all with a heart melting smile and lightening fast reflexes. The CIA couldn't have better publicity.

Annie is loyal, smart, compassionate and deadly when neccesary. Light but very satisfying fare!
Love her, and Alia lady. Very gung ho and confidant. covert government shows are awesome. I wander how far from the truth they are?
The second season  really starts to develop the characters. Annie's  confidence sky rockets  and her missions get more complicated. Overall it is a  fun and entertaining ride.

Series gets better with Annie getting all the plum assignments but still full of the improbable such as Annie outrunning the bad guys, shooting and high speed car chases. But, just relax and suspend judgement, and it is an mindless adventure.  Chris Gorman is HOT! Irritated that Amazon allows me two full seasons, then after I'm really into it, charges for the third season. Cry foul!
I think this show should be on a channel . If its Is convert affairs should be advertised more! I love watching the show, great series!

Covert Affairs is a fun spy-thriller series with engaging characters, but the spy-craft and action scenes are sometimes contrived and a bit fantastical even for television. The scenery and filming on location in various places around the world is a nice diversion.

Amazon Instant Video is convenient for storing content, and the HD quality on my 32" Samsung LCD TV is very good, but I'm not a big fan of the glitchy SEEK, FAST-FORWARD, and REWIND controls that are part of the video streaming world. I wish I had bought this title from Amazon on disk instead of instant video/streaming media.

Its real interesting to see what a special agent goes through.  Keeping secrets of your job from your family members and keeping them safe at the same timeis a lot of work especially emotionally.  I wonder how many directives are thwarted.  I find it odd that a agent that goes against protocol isn't fired. I don't know if I could sleep with the enemy.  I do like the relationship with Annie and Augie. Glad to see it come back for another season.  Also like the theme music.

I am a fan of spy movies. I have liked all of the story lines, the acting and (other than the occasional swimming suit) that this show is clean. I would recommend it for anyone that enjoys a more real feeling to the characters and less superman invincibility. Another positive aspect is the balance of humor and action. This is not all action (James Bond) nor all humor (Austin Powers).

I am thoroughly pleased with this series!, although I must admit that I thought it would be cheezy when I bought it. I was really in an experament with myself to test out some of the more recent series on TV. I don't watch tv because of the stinking commercials. They are getting longer and more frequent than I care to watch.
Anyway, Piper Parabo totally blew me away. She could be one of the better actresses on the up and comming scene. I really like the fact that, while she can play a very vulnerable and sweet, kind, and caring person in one scene, then Kick some real BUTT in the next. She pulls it off with precision timing.
Christopher Gorham is great as well. He really looks like he is blind, and he has such a sincere way of caring about Piper's well being, while being able to pull off a believable tough and sinister side to him as well.
Keri Matchet is a sweetheart, but carries the weight of a leading, make the tough decisions, kind of a real woman. She is probable, for me one of the most sexy women on the screen today, without being cheap or sleezy. I just love her character as well.
Sendhil Ramamurthy does a great job as well.
And last, but not least, Peter Gallagher is a likable character with the ability to pull off the tough decision - maker role well.
All in all I am terifically pleased with all the characters and the great writting staff and the entire hard-working crew of the show.
I love Piper Perabo, and she's great in this series.  Action-packed episodes, and a lot of surprises.  Definitely worth the money.

Okay series, but too reminioscent of Nikita and others of that ilk.  Could use more original plot lines and explore the characters further.  It's not bad; perhaps next season will be more enthralling.

I had not seen Covert Affairs before and decided to use it as a test for the Kindle Fire.  I enjoyed the program, and watching on the Kindle.  The only problem is paying so much to watch what is on free TV.  These programs should be 49 cents an episode.  Let's get real Amazon, you're making money.  I'd watch more if your pricing was better.  Also your platform should be integrated.  Do I really need two clouds?  And why doesn't my changes on the Kindle sync with the cloud?  It is obvious that you had at least three programming groups working separately and with no thought of the consumer!
I love the suspense and the way characters build and interact with each other.  I just discovered this show in its third season and loved getting caught up on the first two seasons.
Love this series. Excellent character development and production. I wasn't able to catch all the episodes when it originally aired. Now I can watch it all at once.

One of the very few shows that I pay to watch. I missed the first season and most of the second, so I'm catching up. I do watch the recent episodes on Hulu (I have no TV). Engaging characters, excellent acting, and believable story lines.
Some of the shows on tv right now are just a waste of time but this show is not and I am glad it is coming bakc for another season.

Having watched season one of "Covert Affairs", there was no doubt in my mind that I had to have season two.  Actress Piper Perabo is perfect for the part of Annie.  Christopher Gorham, Sendhil Ramamurthy, Anne Dudek, Kari Matchett and Peter Gallagher are perfect for their parts as well.  This show features a great cast, adventure, danger, intrigue and romance.  "Covert Affairs" goes one step beyond all of that by making relationships with family and friends real and important.  Each CIA character has the opportunity to portray a little bit of their personal side outside of their job.  A nice contrast to the danger and intrigue aspect of the show.
I love this series. The stories are well written and the acting is great. The stories keep your interest without alot of skin and blood but they are very exciting.

Boos and hisses on Amazon for not having the show's catchy title track (Power's "Can You Save Me") available as an MP3 download. And that may (or may not) be the only negative thing I say here, because COVERT AFFAIRS, one of USA Network's entries in the sub-genre of spy thriller lite, is must-see television in my household. Piper Perabo continues to be compelling as the CIA's latest recruit Annie Walker. As we learned in Season One's first episode, her director has no qualms in immediately plunging her in deep waters, one field assignment chased by another. I am madly in crush with Piper Perabo, and I figure her unusual and catchy name has something to do with it. But there's also that slightly offbeat vibe she's got going on. And I've said this elsewhere, but, man, her face is so expressive and she exudes smarts.

I dunno if this is fact or fiction, but it's established early in the show that the CIA's hiring freeze unfroze after 9/11, which has resulted in 50% of the agency now flaunting a mere 5 years of experience or less. Factor in that Annie placed tops in her spy training class, and maybe the director's decision to deploy Annie so soon is easier to comprehend. In Season 2 Chris Gorham demonstrates that he still flexes those ridiculous abs. Peter Gallagher still parades around with those two pet caterpillars he insists are eyebrows. Season 2 still has me singing along to the catchy theme song. And Season 2 finds Annie Walker less broken-hearted and more the seasoned spy, although she hasn't all the way shed her wide-eyed innocence; she's yet to develop that guarded, cynical shell. But her instincts have been on point from jump. She keeps getting the job done (well, mostly), even if she sometimes steps outside of proper agency protocol. Some may frown at her insubordination. But others may flip that around and call it "showing initiative" and "adapting to adverse situations."

We see what happens to her recently turned-up mystery man, that ex-boyfriend for whom she annoyingly pined for most of last season. That's not to say that her other admirers don't get spotlighted. In "Good Advices" Annie and Mossad agent Eyal Lavin (Oded Fehr, awesome) run into each other and butt heads over a prospective asset, and in "A Girl Like You" Lavin returns to Washington, D.C. on an unsanctioned (and personal) mission. And there are other dudes sniffing around.

Okay, the writing could be sharper, and, honestly, I'm not that into the shady internal politics that go on within the CIA. But the appealing cast and the breezy, upbeat tone help make the show very easy to swallow. Piper Perabo is never less than captivating. She anchors the show effortlessly. I hope this is her breakout role and that she gets more pub out of this, because I think she's talented and deserving. Meanwhile, I'm crossing my fingers for something to develop even more between Annie and her trusted pal Auggie (Chris Gorham). Perabo and Gorham together create serious sparks, but it's probably best that whatever it is they've got going on, it unfolds at a slow burn. By the way, Gorham's blind CIA tech wrangler just may be the best character in the show. Maybe my favorite Season 2 episodes is "Half a World Away," in which Auggie's jazz festival jaunt in Istanbul inadvertently turns into an espionage mission. In this ep, it's revealed how Auggie lost his eyesight.

And, as always, we note the dichotomy between Annie's CIA capers and her sometimes frazzled domestic life with her sister. Season 1 ended with Danielle (Anne Dudek) still believing Annie's Smithsonian cover. In Season 2, cue certain developments.

COVERT AFFAIRS isn't as nerve-jangling or action-packed as 24, isn't as plot-twisty as ALIAS, and our heroine doesn't boast the experience and jadedness of Michael Westen on BURN NOTICE. It tends to be episodic in nature, which results in our not caring that much about the caper of the week. But COVERT AFFAIRS finds a nice balance in showcasing the more glamorous, globe-trotting, adventurous side of Annie's missions with those other assignments in which she deals with the more mundane aspects of the job. I think of all the things that COVERT AFFAIRS isn't, and I'm even more amazed that this show steadily hooks in its share of the Nielsen pie. Piper Perabo is pitch perfect. And it's always neat to discover what other language Annie Walker has mastered. Just as with BONES and with CASTLE, it's not so much the cases as it is the interactions among the cast members that draw us in. And, finally, it's good to see Auggie's close combat sessions with Annie paying off huge. The Season 3 opener is just around the corner, on July 10th. I may fidget anxiously until then.

The COVERT AFFAIRS Season 2 set consists of all 16 episodes on four discs and the following special features: several deleted scenes, a gag reel, Piper's introduction of the series at Comic-Con 2011, and a behind-the-scenes featurette entitled "Covert Affairs On Location."

If you're looking at this for the first time, the story lines are great.  I have watched this series since it came out and everyone in the family really enjoys it, and that's why I buy the DVD's because most good series never stay on TV that long anymore.

A lot of people have already given many reasons to love this show, so I'll list what's actually in the disk collection you're buying because let's be honest, that's the only real reason to buy the season DVDs anyhow.

Disk 1:
1. Begin the Begin
2. Good Advices
3. Bang and Blame
4. All the Right Friends
-Bonus: Deleted Scenes for Good Advices (1:19)

Disk 2:
5. Around the Sun
6. The Outsiders
7. Half a World Away
8. Welcome to the Occupation
-Bonus: Deleted Scenes for Around the Sun (1:07) and Half a World Away (1:18)

Disk 3:
9. Sad Professor
10. World Leader Pretend
11. The Wake-Up Bomb
12. Uberlin
-Bonus: Deleted Scenes for Sad Professor (1:03), World Leader Pretend (4:45), and Uberlin (0:51)

Disk 4:
13. A Girl Like You
14. Horse to Water
15. What's the Frequency, Kenneth?
16. Letter Never Sent
-Bonus: Deleted Scenes for What's the Frequency, Kenneth? (1:16) and Letter Never Sent (1:00)
*Gag Reel (short and funny!! Piper has a mouth on her, but it's all censored out.)
*Piper Perabo Comic-Con Intro (Kinda confusing, I thought that this would be an interview or something but it's a funny gag with Annie going off task at Comic Con following "intel". Eh, short and a little pointless.)
*Covert Affairs on Location: Istanbul, Venice, Berlin, and Stockholm (Probably the best bonus feature of this box set, it follows Chris Gorham who plays Auggie Anderson as he goes on location and shoots little video diaries and behind the scene snippets of his costars. Interesting and personal, I felt a part of the Covert Affairs family by watching it. Roughly 16 minutes with all of them.)

Unfortunately, the one thing that this box set is missing is the cast and creator commentaries on certain episodes. I love those best, because I love to hear what little nuggets of wisdom the actors have and reminisce on. It's odd that this set offers nothing of the sort this time around, especially when practically every other TV show I have encountered has at least one episode like that, but the COVERT AFFAIRS ON LOCATION definitely helped my bummed feeling on the matter.

Worth it, especially if it's for a good price. I got mine for around $20, so I am very happy with the set overall.

I enjoy the show tremendously.  It's a real guilty pleasure.  Although you always know that things will turn out okay in the end, the road getting there is often slick, slippery, and filled with twists and turns.  The characters are appealing and the dialog is contemporary without sounding like a junior high schooler's tweet. The starring and supporting casts are very good and include a long-time favorite of mine, Peter Gallagher.  A number of episodes during season two were shot abroad, adding to the adventure of the show.  The action sequences are top drawer, with Dog Liman, of "Go" and the "Bourne Trilogy," serving as Executive Producer.  The boxed set includes the season's complete episodes, along with deleted scenes, a brief gag reel, and commentary by the actors and producers. Enjoy!

This is action packed! I love the backstories and learning about each character. I love the small town girl meets big time CIA. It's great.

This show shoould dig deeper into the reality of the CIA but what can you expect from a tv show. It does better than most though even though the show has a light tone to it. I belive the writers should make the show a bit heavier so it is a little more believable or real, sometimes it gets so light it reminds me of Glee. If they took some tips from the writers of Burn Notice this show has some great potential. It is very entertaining as it is and one of my favorite shows and this episode was not a bad way to end the season however it couldve been a bit more dramatic seeing how the show is based off the CIA, the most famous of the 16 intelligence community agency/offices of the U.S. So with this subject matter as a base for the show, the writers need to make it a little bit more real life. I am impressed that they use correct CIA termanology and Geographic termanology most of the time. This shows they did a good job of researching for the show. They need to not let this research go to waste and they need to add weight to the show. It also sometimes reminds me CSI Miami but CIA instead. Covert Affairs is good but has the potential to become great. On another note Amazon needs to manage their downloading tools better but watching the show streaming online is almost flawless.

I picked up Covert Affairs on a whim.  I'm a long time La Femme Nikita, Nikita, Alias, Buffy fan, so the female spy with ninja skills and a heart of gold story line is one that I have enjoyed, but one that now has a pretty high standard to live up to.  Piper Perabo is simply a pleasure to watch in this role, from start to finish.  She pretty much had me twisted around her little pinky a few episodes in when I realized that she had the power to go from funny to heartbreaking in a few moments.  I've really enjoyed Christopher Gorham since "Jake 2.0", and seeing him here is not unlike seeing him in that role again--a computer wise spy guy.  The trick here is that he is blind, but every bit as deadly and capable as his sighted companions.  The evolving relationship between Perabo and Gorham on screen kept me coming back in season 1, and in season 2 it just gets better.  Annie and Auggie make perfect friends and foils, their banter and friendship are the secret to what makes this show great.  The moment in episode 7 when we learn more about Auggie's blindness...well, I'll leave you hopefully wondering.  Jump on the Covert Affairs train.  It's a great ride and a lot of fun.

There may be inconsistencies...and sure, sometimes the spycraft is a bit far fetched...but this is a USA show.  It's about the characters!  This Auggie-centric episode finally answers the question of: How did he become blind?  It really is a heart wrenching story.  You see the character in a light that you really only got to glimpse at before.  His friendship with Annie is put to the test and at the end of the episode you really get a sense of how close these two have become.  Whether the writers put them together in a romantic sense or not...it's one of the best relationships out there.  The final scene with Auggie and Annie at Allen's Tavern is enough to make even the most hardened person cry.  The use of Gaslight Anthem's "We Did It When We Were Young" is inspired.  One of the best episodes yet.

I absolutely love this show and have a growing respect for USA and their development team.  If you want to get to know the characters you're watching NOT necessarily care about the missions...then really, you can't go wrong with Covert Affairs.  It's fun.  I can't wait for the 2nd half of the 2nd Season in November. :)
IF YOU LIKE EXCITEMENT, THEN THIS SHOW IS JUST WHAT YOU NEED. I CANNOT WAIT FOR EACH ESPIODE EVERY WEEK. SLICK ACTION AND VERY FAMILY FRIENDLY.

I started watching Covert Affairs on Hulu and moved over to Amazon Instant to fulfill my addiction to this spy show. Seriously, take my word when I say this show is Awesome! I jumped in during Season 2 watching free shows on Hulu during the summer lull in quality TV programming, and found myself jumping to Amazon to catch up on back episodes. I'm surprised that this show pulled me in. I thought nothing could compare to Kiefer Sutherland and the exciting action involved in every episode of 24's action drama. Piper Perabo nails her role as the lead spy on Covert Affairs. My other favorite characters are Ben Mercer (Eion Bailey who is super hot), Jai Wilcox (Sendhil Ramamurthy from Heros) and Auggie Anderson (Christopher Gorham). I hope USA Network keeps producing Covert Affairs for a long time.
